Ratings.comment: As long as you pay attention and participate, she is very kind and helpful. Those in my class that didn't landed on her sh*t list and it was very easy to tell. She grades very easily and tries to give you as many points as she can on questions you get wrong (half points, etc.) which is awesome for a language class.

makes Spanish so much more enjoyable. she is genuinely a good person, and really cares for her students. amazing grader, and just an all around fun class, I had it from 6-8 pm (a terrible time), and I honestly couldn't wait to go! highly recommend taking this Spanish class.

She is one of the best Spanish teachers I've ever had. She is SO nice &  fun. She explains things very well & she's very helpful. I looked forward to going to her class each day because she made learning Spanish super fun. She's super interesting & our whole class loved her. She really cares about her students & is so sweet . She is THE best.

Loved having her, she really care about her students and wants to see them do well and enjoy the Spanish culture as much as she does. She seemed a little scary at first but she is very caring and empathetic to her students.

Hannah Grace is a wonderful and caring professor. It is very clear how much she cares about the Spanish culture, the language, and her students. She does require a lot of homework, however, this is understandable considering how hard it is to learn a language. I wish I could take her again for Spanish 3.

Very very caring, puts in large amounts of time to make sure lectures are real world integrated and helpful. By far best Spanish teacher I have had, I feel I have learned way more Spanish than I ever did in my three years of high school. If you show up and put in a little effort you will do fine. Wish I could take her for Spanish 2!!!
I have had a good experience with this professor at Clark State.
Very nice, and very willing to help the students.  She makes sure that you understand everything, and is genuinely a great person.  I would HIGHLY recommend taking her course.

Very nice, and extremely helpful.  Makes sure all the students understand the readings, and is willing to work with you if you need anything.  Wonderful professor, and I would HIGHLY recommend taking her course.
Very good professor. She was incredibly nice and very good at teaching. She knows her stuff too and is easy to understand.

She is easy. This was my first and only span class at osu and I hadn't taken spanish since high school. Tests are dept issued, but there are outlines on the dept website. She is easy going and very understanding. No quizzes and easy homework!!
No Comments

You will definitely feel challenged but in a way that keeps you thinking outside of class about the discussions and readings. As long as you can relate the readings/lectures to your own life and show that, then it is an easy A.
Loved her! She is so awesome
Professor Costello cares students a lot and understands students with a great flexibility on homework and participation. As long as you do your best, she won't disappoint you.

I have know Elena for some time now and she is an amazing educator. Everyhthing she says, she says with passion. She isn't afraid to speak her mind which is something that I appreciate in a person and educator. Overall an amazing human being!
Super sweet and caring for all of her students. She's quick to help you because she wants to see you succeed! Take this class with her if you can!

Really caring. She wants every one to succeed in the class. She is always willing to help and is not looking to give you more work than necessary. Loved the class and the best Spanish teacher I've had so far.

Costello is a really great professor! She cares about the success of her students and does her best to teach through participation. The class was fun and laid back, better than any other Spanish classes Ive taken! Do your work and youll do great! She even wrote me a recommendation for a study abroad trip I applied for later in the year!
Very difficult person. I will never take class she teaches. I will remember er name.
I wished I had never taken a Spanish class she was teaching. I will remember her name and the way she did me.
Sra. Nutor was very nice. She patiently answered questions and helped anyone who needed it. She prepared students well for the exams and homework was minimal and easy.

As a person, Nutor is kind and is willing to help if you have a question. She just feels fast-paced in class and expects you to study every night before class. She has you get into groups a lot. She's a great grader. Very reasonable with it. Attending class is mandatory. You can only have so many absences before you lose 1% per absence.

Sra. Nutor was caring and the class was extremely well-organized. She always graded assignments quickly and offered to help students. If you work hard in the class and study the appropriate amount, you will get an A.

I love this lady. She teaches content a little at a time and while you have to memorize vocabulary on your own, she does a lot of activities to help you understand everything. You are lucky if you get her as your teacher because I dont know any other teacher that gives free homework passes out as rewards for winning one of the games you play.

Professor Nutor is a very good professor. Learning a foreign language is not easy, however, Professor Nutor gives many tools to help you really learn the material. Although her class can feel like you're back in 3rd grade again it makes sense since language wise you are just at a young child's level. Definitely wish she taught Spanish 1103 too.

I didn't get Spanish until I had this lady! She makes the class fun with games, jeapordy, a end of semester fiesta, and sometimes gives you candy during the test. Charismatic, good class strucutre, NOT BORING, and the students seem to like her. Highly reccommend her as a teacher, I wish she is still my Spanish teacher =)
really good teacher.  presented material in various interesting ways.
Great teacher, very nice, lots of fun activities.  She really makes sure students learn the material.

I hated Spanish before I took Nutor's class. She has a lot of very helpful activities (not the dumb ones from the book). The way she taught made me enjoy coming to class and I learned the material very easily. I would love to have her for the rest of my Spanish classes...

Amazing professor. You can tell that he is very passionate about teaching his students, which makes learning in his class a lot easier. His class is most rewarding if you attend lecture and participate in conversation and activities.

My fav prof this year. He is funny and really cares if you do well. Super helpful outside of class. Assigns a decent amount of hw assignments (some harder than others) but nothing too bad. Doesnt call on you randomly in class. Speaks mostly Spanish but occasionally in English if needed. Pretty easy A if you put in effort. Definitely try to get him!

Hugo was probably my favorite Spanish professor I've had so far. He is very easy to talk to and gives great feedback about your pronunciation. The way he set the class up is very organized. There are two oral exams but you're given the opportunity to meet with him for a practice oral exam before the real one which is very helpful.

BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD! She really cares about her students and the online quick homework was super helpful. You can try as many times on homework until you get 100%. She also does test reviews that look exactly like the test but have different verbs. She makes it Spanish really simplified and less stressful. You enjoy learning the culture 2.

I absolutely love Dr. Grace!! She's always prepared and well-organized. She also shows a great interest in what she teaches and it shows through her enthusiasm. Professor Grace is also really funny sometimes without meaning to be. Love her and love the class. Definitely recommend her!! Oh and for the guys: she is pretty cute.

Carmen is THE BEST spanish teacher at ohio state, hands down.  Take her class, she will make you 10X better at Spanish.  She may seem to speak fast at first, but you catch on very quickly.  I would take her every quarter if I could.

At first this class was hard and really made me think twice about the Span minor. But Ms. Grace is an excellent teacher who is determined for her students to succeed. Best Spanish teacher I have ever had; my Spanish has never improved so significantly.
She's a great spanish teacher, by far the best I've ever had at OSU.  She's always prepared and is very enthusiastic about what she teahes.  HIGHLY recommend her.  And she's kinda hot.
Excellent.  Learned a lot in this class.  Gracias!!
I had Mrs Grace a few qtrs ago.  One of my best teachers!!!  Muchasismas Gracias.
just heard her read a paper in Duquesne.  Fantastic

Just found this site and my old teacher.  I had Mrs Grace a couple of qtrs ago.  I was wondering if to conitinue with Spanish in college.  After taking the class with Mrs Grace I was convinced to continue and even minored in it.  She was always prepared, gave great instructions and broght Spain to the classroom.  Wish I could write 1000 words here.
Great teacher, always made the class fun.  Was one of the best classes I have taken in Spanish or any other course. Nice on the eyes too.  CALIENTE!!!
She was a very fun teacher and had fun with the class. I highly recommend her, especially after hearing horror stories of the other Spanish 103.66 teachers

What everyone else said. Carmen is GREAT! i loved her, i thought she was VERY lenient with grading. Hard to understand at first because she's from spain, but she's really helpful and tries to help her students. I loved her.

Great teacher! very helpful. Pay attention to all of the little exercises you do in class because they are mostly geared straight to the test... especially if she gives "extra" homework... take your time and do it really well, because you are probably writing the next day's composition!
Carmen was wonderful.  She was very helpful and very easy.  She was also very bubbly and sweet.  Great teacher.
She's a great teacher. A little hard to interpret at first because she talks really fast.. but good otherwise. very helpful and very nice.
A hard grader that will not let anything slide, including small mistakes like accent marks and what not. She does an oral review before every class so be ready for her to call on you!
shes a great teacher, geniuenly interested in helping students, if you pay attention in class and do the hw its not hard to get an A. I would def reccommend her for the class!!!
she was very helpful with deadines...
No Comments
Fun teacher, sometimes hard to understand.  Very easy when it comes to grading tests and projects.
From Madrid takes a couple days to understand her. Unique/effective teaching style.

I'd believe that Ryder wasn't great a few years ago, but as he has gotten more teaching experience he has improved greatly and clearly really cares about the subject. He comes across as a bit awkward at times, but is funny, approachable, and understanding. As long as you do the homework and pay attention, it's hard to fail.

He doesnt seem to know what hes talking about half the time. I understand that hes not a native speaker, but his accent is so bad that it can be hard to understand him at times. He also makes a lot of mistakes with pronunciation. Cunningham hardly prepares us for compositions or explains much besides going over homework. Pick a different teacher

Does not care about her students mental health & does not care about the effort put into the work that u do. Unorganized also. Highly do not recommend Im sure theres a better instructor for your spanish 1 class.

Weekly quizzes that were not hard as you got multiple attempts. There were 7 reading journals and 4 tareas that he assigned and would take points off on things that were not in his example or the rubric. Same goes for final project as he docks you on points you didn't even know you were graded on. Overall it wasn't a ton of work but bad grader.

No tests and the final is a group project. He had an extra credit assignment worth 10% of our final grade. His grading criteria is sometimes inconsistent and the lectures can be boring. The class itself is easy if you are good at Spanish and can write well. Well worth it and definitely a chill class/professor.

Profe Ben is super sweet, but his lectures are not exactly entertaining. It's boring content (grammar and linguistics) and he just doesn't really make up for it. The class isn't very difficult but sometimes his grading is inconsistent on the tareas and quizzes, but overall a painless experience.
He didnt assign much hw

His course is graded by weekly quizzes from videos, homework, and group projects. He is a really caring professor and keeps students engaged in his lectures. If you stay on top of your work and take notes on the videos assigned, it will be an easy A.

He is by far the best professor I have had at OSU. He is so caring about you and your learning and really wants you to succeed. He is extremely easy to talk to and is always super responsive over email. He also allowed me to interview him for one of my other Spanish classes and it was the best experience ever. Overall, I TOTALLY RECOMMEND!!!
Ben was so nice! He loves his cats and he cares about his students - what more could you want? He's also very good at explaining concepts in lecture, and he was a pretty easy grader.

Ben is a great Spanish professor. The course itself is moderated by the Spanish department, so a lot of what Ben does is out of his control. However, he always made time for us to ask questions at the end of class. There was daily homework and participation was self-graded. The course was not that hard, but studying is definitely required to learn.

I made spanish seem so easy, that I started taking his classes to boost my GPA. His quizzes and exams are very easy compared to other lecturers. He talks alot about his cats. The only hard part about his class is the oral exam.

Very fun to be around, I genuinely enjoyed learning the Spanish language from him. He loves his cats and is extremely easy to talk to and ask questions about the material. I was worried about starting a new language since sometimes the professors can be intimidating or hard to understand, Ben was the exact opposite of those things.
The class itself was really easy, but it was so boring it was nearly impossible to stay focused. He definitely knows the material but it's not super intriguing. Easy A, but just boring.

he is funny and awesome, speaks in english half the time to help. homework is easy, very reassuring when it comes to nervousness about tests and online conversations. he's super helpful with confusing concepts and is very forgiving. would definitely take any class of his again!
Great professor. Easy to understand and will work with you on anything you need. Grades very fairly as well. Definitely would take again.
Would not recommend if you actually want to learn anything. She makes the class feel overwhelming with all these assignments spread out in two weeks.

Sra. Hardman is an extremely understanding teacher that will absolutely help you out when you need it. Study for the quizzes and you should do well. The rest of the assignments are very lenient and she will help you out if she likes you. Very easy to get on her good side just be respectful, participate, and communicate when necessary.

Professor Barton was my favorite professor this semester. You can tell that she understands that there are more things going on in her students' lives than school. Her lectures made an intimidating topic incredibly engaging and fun to learn about. She allows late work and gives thorough feedback which I really appreciated. I highly recommend!

My main complaint is the fact that she often came across as very unprofessional/unorganized. This is an easy class, but we never had clear directions/criteria for assignments. Personally I found her annoying and she got off track very often. Way too chill about attendance/due dates- college kids need to be taught accountability, not slacking off.

Paige was a godsend last semester! Shes very understanding about personal things that could possibly keep you from class and she really cares about your well-being. We had weekly homework quizzes, a few homework assignments, weekly field notebooks, and a final paper. I came to maybe 30% of the classes and still got an A so you should be fine.

I loved this class and Prof. Barton! She is vv understanding and accepts late work w/o penalty. The class consists of powerpoint lectures, weekly Carmen quizzes (take about 10 mins), weekly field notebooks where you find examples off social media (reddit, netflix, twitter, IG), and longer hw assignments once a month. No tests, just a final paper.

Paola is my favorite Spanish professor I have had at OSU so far. She is very knowledgeable, helpful, and the instructions are clear. She encourages participation and it is important for success in this class. Her class is so well-organized that it flies by. Definitely attend class and you will succeed! I will look out for other courses she teaches.

Paola will make a great professor in the future. She talks a little fast but overall is good at explaining things and shares her slides. This course was taught from a book; honestly, you really don't have to read- you can skim for answers mostly- but it makes the exams, quizzes, and following along in lecture easier if you did read.

I really enjoyed this class and I would reccommend attending class. If you don't, you probably will not be able to complete the assignments. Sometimes the instructions are difficult to understand, so make sure to ask questions. Paola is great and will definitely help you out as long as you put in effort. The final project was graded leniently.

Her entire class is spoken in Spanish so if you struggle with Spanish she is not for you. You are going to be overwhelmed with homework. Every week there are assignments and quizzes You have to speak to 2 other people from Spanish speaking countries as well as an oral exam with her, 6 charlas,  and 3 writing assignments that are proctored.

Unlike most professors she truly wants you to succeed. Gives lots of practice and her grading was pretty reasonable. Lots of work in this class though with weekly homework assignments and times where you have to record yourself speaking Spanish. Overall I was really nervous about this course but it went much better than I expected.
IMO one of the better Spanish professors at OSU. She's gives plenty of practice and is pretty understandable in grading.

Caroline is very sweet and caring for her students. She does tend to focus more on the culture aspect of the class though instead of teaching vocabulary and grammar. Most activities in class are straight from the textbook. She assigns a lot of homework throughout the week and tends to assign the weeks homework last minute, so its hard to work ahead

Caroline was a wonderful professor - very passionate about the language and the culture of Spanish-speaking countries. She is super easy to talk to, and allowed for a close-knit class, many of whom were at different levels. There's a decent amount of homework but as long as you get it done and participate, you are sure to pass.

I loved having professor Shipley. The Spanish itself was pretty easy. Everyone entered the class at differing levels and everyone was able to learn at their own pace. The class was hybrid and being able to have her in person is very pleasant. Theres lot of homework that you need to stay on top of. Definitely have to work for your grade.

Caroline was extremely passionate about the Spanish language and culture of Spanish-speaking countries! Very approachable and helpful, but the class itself was a little bit more challenging than expected. I wouldn't say the class is an "easy A."

Caroline was the worst Spanish teacher I ever had. Multiple times she didn't know the answer to grammar questions. I actually felt like I got dumber when I was in class. I started going to the learning center for help on grammar because she wouldn't teach in class- homework would say to learn it ourselves. If you find out you have her, switch out.
Alfonso clearly cares about teaching. Thanks to his attention to detail, responsiveness, and engaging lesson delivery, the class was a very pleasant and enjoyable experience!

Alfonso is a great professor. We had to buy both textbooks for this class, but they were used a fair amount and the in class discussions relied on the fact that you read the chapter. Grades were mostly from two papers we wrote and 2 group projects. He was very understanding when any problems arose so I would definitely recommend taking his class.

Most definitively my favorite class at OSU. Alfonso's classes were full plot twist that would keep you engaged and made you rethinking everything you thought you knew in life! Although there were many assignments, I felt they were meaningful and helped me understand the material.
very kind and understanding.

Linda is very patient. She understands taking a second language isn't easy. (Especially if you haven't taken a Spanish class in 2 years). She does assign homework but they are only a couple exercises a night which are actually good practice. She makes sure you are prepared and know what expect on exams.

Professor Markels understands that 1102 is just an introductory course. Even though she and the students are supposed to speak only in Spanish for the whole semester, she lets you speak in English and does so herself for the majority of the time. She plans very helpful activities to really get the topics stuck in your head. Nice, but not a pushover

Very helpful but her teaching style isn't clear.  She teaches half the material and expects you to know what she doesnt teach.  Weird teaching style.  Doesn't focus on the right things to get the material in our head. Likes teaching abt spanish countries and not so much spanish.  Unnecessarily hard grader for spanish 102

Andy is an amazing Spanish professor who brings his energy and enthusiasm into the classroom with him. He made logging into a 2 and half hour class each day bearable (and some parts even fun). He is strict with his grading, but he does everything he can to prepare his students well before he grades. Be prepared to work, but Andy will always help.

He is a wonderful person and teacher, but this is just beginning Spanish and it shouldnt have been this hard. Ive taken many Spanish classes in high school and I know a lot, but he expects you to know way too much even in the very first unit. Im disappointed, because I love Spanish, but he made me not like it as much.

You will have to put a lot of effort into this class to get a decent grade. He is very outgoing and has a very loud personality. In-class work and homework is pretty manageable but the tests are all written and challenging especially if you have never taken spanish before. He learned spanish in Spain so he speaks with different pronunciation.

He is the best Professor I had for my Spanish class. He really cares for his students. Although his tests are hard, he explains everything in the class. Complete the online homework and you will do good in the exams.
He facilitates very helpful discussion and is tough but reasonable on grading. I learned so much and it laid a great foundation for my Spanish minor.

He's absolutely wonderful. Take anything he teaches. He doesn't curve and doesn't offer extra credit, but you won't need it if you pay attention in class and do all of your required reading. He has endless enthusiasm and energy, and it really shows in class. The lectures are interactive and well worth your time. I can't recommend him highly enough!

Andy was probably my favorite Spanish instructor I have had so far during my 4 yr Spanish career at OSU. Class was very interesting and I learned a lot not only about Spanish films, but also about Spain's history which I think it's much more important. I would recommend him to anyone taking Spanish classes.
Andy has a great sense of humor! While he didn't assign that many graded assignments, he gave extensive feedback on what he did assign and was very helpful for coming up with ideas for papers.
He insists that he's one of the hardest teachers you'll ever have, but you should ignore this. He epitomizes fairness and he's always willing to help you out.

Andy is really awesome. If you plan on continuing your education in Spanish, he will help you edit papers for future classes. Right now he's a grad student, but he will make a great professor one day.
I hate Spanish, but this guy is a fair and good guy.  The tests are written by the department and not by him but he is a fairly easy grader.  He is a good guy
Ryan was good. He was very interested in Spanish and teaching it. The textbook is online and will be needed. The course wasnt too hard but the tests were more difficult than I expected.

Professor Emery average. She assigns a lot of homework that really isnt worth anything, because it is put in as a zero in Carmen. Participation really matters and is worth a lot, so try to answer questions in class. I found myself being very bored in class, but she is very sweet. I am not very good at Spanish and I got a B.

Way more work than the credit hours specified. Dozens of assignments a week and not all of them even count towards your grade but you don't know which ones. The attendance policy is ridiculous however she is very understanding if you have to miss for illness or personal reasons. Always working in groups. Randomly calls on students.

I very much so disliked my semester with Amy Emery. My least favorite things are that she doesnt know how to use Canvas, and assigns a lot of homework that all go ungraded, and is only necessary for participation (which also has no grade weight, so its pointless) + she is rude. she does allow for a lot of ways to improve your scores so that's a +

Amy Emery's class is easy as long as you do the daily homework and come to class. However, the lectures were boring and I dreaded going to this class. She randomly calls on everyone and when a student is struggling to answer, she will make you feel incredibly stupid. She also plays favorites with the students who answer correctly and participate.

Professor Emery may seem dry but shes a nice lady and does a good job at preparing you for her tests/quizzes. There is online Pearson homework every night and two recorded Talk Abroad conversations with native Spanish speakers. Overall easier than my high school spanish classes that I took. You dont need to be great at spanish to get an A.
Entire class in spoken in Spanish, homework every night. 3 exams, 1 composition and 2 talk abroads. She's not a bad professor, just not necessarily a good one either.

It's not hard to get an A, just show up (attendance is required) and prepare yourself for the in class essays (I put in 1-2 hours of work a week). However, Amy does not have an interest in providing extra help and she won't upload any of your grades (so you only know what you have when you get the final grade). She's also not very approachable.

I had Amy for Spanish 3403 lecture, and she's a very sweet woman. Frankly, the class is fairly boring and unfortunately very few people from the class would participate at all, which was incredibly frustrating. She didn't have much to work with, but she didn't do much with it. She was a straightforward grader. Show up and do the work type of class.
Professor Emery was decent. She gives a lot of busy work: homework every night, a 200 word composition, and some other small assignments but overall this class is an easy A

Worst professor I have ever had. Transfer classes ASAP. I knew after the first day that I should have changed classes but all the other Spanish 1103 at that time were full. She is very rude and disrespectful and will stand there and laugh at your wrong answers. Don't even think about asking her a question because she'll make you feel stupid. LEAVE.

spanish 3403. She is not helpful and very condescending even when I went to office hours to get extra help she treated me like I was stupid. Rude in class, homework and reading is annoying. Not a fan. You won't fail the class but it is not enjoyable and she makes things harder than they need to be.

Amy is an okay professor but lacks enthusiasm and that's where her class falls short. One on one she came off as very disrespectful, talking over me, and she is just is not good at being personable. Go to class and don't skip is honestly my best advice. The class is extremely easy, just the professor for the class is the only problem.
She was very helpful and she always kept the class fun and interesting. I definitely would reccomend her.
She was very helpful and she always kept the class fun and interesting.
Not very enthusiastic and class isn't fun, but she really prepares us well for the exams.
Emery is an okay teacher, class goes by very slow and it's always boring.  She prepares you for tests pretty decently. Overall she is an alright teacher, just very dull.
Really attentive and patient teacher. Would definitely recommend her for any Spanish class.
Professor Emery is probably the BEST professor I've ever had at Ohio State. She really prepares you for exams, and the class is a breeze. Take it with her!

This is a vocabulary building class that prepares you to take the SLURP exam. The focus is more on practicing writing than learning grammar. Exams are comprised of almost entirely short answer and essay questions. Professor Emery is accommodating and perceptive to students' needs and grades somewhat leniently.

Great teacher! She was very helpful as a teacher and wanted to make sure that we learned something from the class. The assignments and tests weren't too difficult, and the workload wasn't burdensome. Good class (especially because it lets you skip right to the upper-level Spanish classes). Strongly recommend.
Emery was a fair teacher. She was clear when she explained things, but she didn't offer a lot of help. If you don't have a good grip on Spanish, then you will have a hard time in this class.

She was really nice and helpful going over the stories with lots of detail and helping us prepare for the slrpe really well. Nice way to get ahead in Spanish minor/major coursework for honors students because you can skip 250. Definitely worth taking for majors/minors

I really liked Sra. Emery.  She was nice and was always making sure we understood what was happening in the stories we read.  Class could be slow at times but she speaks very clear Spanish and the work is pretty straightforward.  If you are semi-interested in Spanish it's definitely not a bad honors class to take.  I think I learned a lot.
Easiest class of my life. Not hard at all, joke of an honors class. Lots of homework thats not worth much, but shes an easy grader and makes easy tests.

she was able to thoroughly go over the material but if i could stay awake through half of the class it would be a huge accomplishment. really boring and she calls you out if youre texting so it makes it a little more difficult to pass the time
Prof. Emery is knowledgeable but incredibly dull. I like Spanish but that class went by agonizingly slowly.

Incredibly boring in class, but she prepares students perfectly for the tests and is a nice woman. She has no problem taking the time to help students. Spanish 104 is a horrible class but she does a pretty good job at making sure the students know everything they will need to in order to do well. Shes a pretty easy grader so its atleast an easy B.

Great teacher! She was a lot of fun, even if the class was really tired. She made going to class a lot easier then it normally was. On the last day of class, we threw a party, and one of the students brought in a toaster oven. I'd totally recommend this teacher to anyone
Very helpful and clear and what she is teaching. Very easy to get an A if you pay attention and study a little for the exam. Very open and laid back class and I recommend her highly.
Book was hard but I learned a lot. She's  challengng but very, very good. It was an interesting class, I'd recommend it if ur motivated.
She is sooooooooo boring!
Very easy class... should be an easy A. Just go to class and most of all participate. She loves me because I'm always raising my hand.

I would never recommend this teacher. She makes you feel like and idiot and automatically makes going to this class a chore. She obsesses over the smart kid, and then embarrasses everyone else. She does not care if students fail, or if they are trying. If you are NOT naturally gifted in Spanish you will not enjoy this class.

She speaks very clearly and goes over the reading material various times, only problem shes really boring and if you dont know something she kinda gives u an attitude and says you should have learn that before. Overall i would say she's an alright prof for spanish 250.
I'm a B average student in Spanish, and this woman will call people out in class and make them feel like complete idiots. I've been crying for two days. Hope you don't like your self-esteem.
Started class early and ended late. boring professor. However she spoke very clear spanish, and was an approachable prof. would reccomend her.

Horrible professor...she always started class early and ended late without consideration for students who had other classes to get to.  She makes you feel extremely dumb for not being fluent in Spanish and is harsh with grades.  Avoid at all costs.
Very good teacher, was involved and used good methods to teach. One of the best Spanish teacher's I've had.

Sra Miller is a great woman. I loved her class, the only reason its hard is because the department is hard itself. She tries to be understanding and really is, you cant skip classes but thats the department and the tests are hard but they standardize them. She does a lot of partner work too. I had an 8am and she made it enjoyable.

Señora Miller was a great professor. Very helpful and made the class fun. I actually enjoyed going to Spanish and participating in the activities she planned. There is a bunch of homework due every Sunday, but if you work on it throughout the week, its manageable. For the exams/quizzes, make quizlets using the vocab from the textbook!

For Spanish classes like this I feel like the professor can only help you so much. All of the coursework is determined by the department and not the professor. It's a fast paced class and if you struggled in high school it'll probably be difficult. Lots of homework due every Sunday and daily homework during the week. Some assignments throughout.

If you dont like Spanish I wouldnt take her as a professor. Def makes you work for it. She will help you if you ask for it but there is a lot of things that are graded and class is almost every day, which isnt her fault.

Quizzes, exams, and finals were not hard at all! She is great at teaching & very helpful. No assigned textbook readings, just helps to have & will need it for homework (which is very easy). Attendance is not mandatory, but her lectures are great so I always went. If you're looking for a sign to take her class, this is it. She is the best, I promise

Señora Miller is absolutely amazing! The class itself is easy - most of its review from past Spanish classes taken in high school. Work load is very reasonable, won't take up too much of your time. Few small quizzes, 2 exams, & a final & they were all open note (taken online). She is very nice and caring and always made me laugh! She is the best!!!

One of the best professors I've had at OSU! She follows protocol for the spanish department to a T (including attendance, daily hw, and participation). She cares so much about her students and tries to make class as interesting as possible. She will help you with any questions you may have and I would definitely have her again if I could.

Professor Miller made me feel like I was back in high school. She is definitely one of my more "rule-following" professors (no phones on the desk, penalized for tardiness, etc) You will find yourself putting way too much time into a Spanish gen ed class. Also, she grades super harshly for someone who isn't even a native Spanish speaker herself.
She's very personable and genuinely cares about her students. She makes Spanish class fun and also takes the time to actually get to know her students.

Profesora Miller is a godsend. She is so caring and her love for teaching shows in all of her lectures. In class, a lot of activities are done that seem silly, but actually help with learning vocabulary and grammar. She is a great professor and I would recommend taking her course.

I had Professor Miller for 1155 and 1103. She is probably the most casual/laidback professor I've had at OSU. You can tell she enjoys teaching, although if you're actually hoping to learn Spanish really thoroughly, you aren't likely to get that out of the class. Most people just take these classes because they have to though and she's good for that

Professor Miller was honestly the worst instructor I have had at Ohio State. She picks on people and barely knows the material herself. If you are pretty good at Spanish, do not take her class. She refuses to give 100s on assignments and admitted this to me after having left no comments on my composition, but gave me a 48/50.

Professor Miller is such a caring and funny person. She always manages to make the 8am Spanish bearable. You get online homework once a week and some occasional bookwork. She is very relax in her grading, especially the oral Exam (as she knows we are learning). She prepares you well for formatives and is overall great!

Profesora Miller is a really great teacher; I always enjoy her class and shes really nice and funny too. like the class is not too hard but still takes some effort to get an A. Theres not a lot of homework besides studying, and I felt like the lectures were very representative of what is on the tests.
Professor Miller is the best professor I've had yet at Ohio State. She cares so much about her students and wants them to succeed. She is hilarious and makes you want to come to class.

She takes points off even if you have to miss class for an illness and insists it is department policy but other Spanish teachers don't do that. She also grades the spanish labs super weirdly. It doesn't matter if you get 100% on every assignment- you will never get 100% in the grade book. She also goes on weird unrelated rants every class.

She is energetic, she actually cares and wants you to understand and is very clear about what will and won't be on tests and exams. She's not a tough grader, and she makes 8:00am classes less boring and exhausting.

Shelly Miller is truly a great professor. She cares so much and our class is very fun. One thing that I am not a huge fan of is the fact that we teach ourselves a decent amount of grammar which is what is hardest in Spanish (in my opinion). But, other than that great class, pretty easy and really fun.

Her classes include a lot of group work, but it's not very hard.  There's online homework due at the end of every week and a little bit of textbook homework almost every day.   She's really funny and easygoing so going to her class was overall pretty enjoyable.

She is so sweet! She really cares about your grade and answers any questions you may have. (No matter how dumb you think they may be) She has no judgement towards students and explains things very well. I received a B+ in this class because I honestly did not give my 110%, but if you put in the effort, you should receive an A with no issues.

Shelley Miller is a great professor! She is SO funny and so easy to talk to. Homework is important and attendance is as well. Overall, she is amazing and I would love to have her as a professor for many more semesters
Shelley was the best Spanish teacher I've ever had. Even better, I genuinely enjoyed going to her class each day. If you have the opportunity to, enroll in one of her Spanish sections!

She is AWESOME! So nice and sweet. Plus, her class is dumb easy, the only thing you have to watch out for is the homework and attendance. Those two can sort of mess with your grade, try to not go lower than 80% hw completion each week.

Great teacher.  She's funny and passionate about teaching. She's laid back but respected by the students.  Lots of homework but that is to be expected in a foreign language class. Over all great professor.
Pretty easy class. There's kind of a lot of homework, but is worth doing.

Professor Appel is super sweet, really helpful, and works hard to make sure you understand the language. I highly recommend her if the course is available, and although the Spanish department has a tough and strict curriculum, she does great working with it and providing a good learning environment.
she was super sweet and nice and really cares about her students. Most of her class is on nearpod. Super sweet and always willing to help her students.

Professor Appel is so nice!! There is weekly homework through the online textbook and assignments to bring to class completed, but the work is not challenging. The exams, writing assignment, and oral exam are graded fairly. If you attend class, do all the homework, and show effort during class, youll do really well.
Ms. Appel teaches at OSU and a nearby high school. She was very helpful and passionate about the language. Definitely helped me achieve the A I wanted
Super nice professor, doesnt grade too hard. Very good beginner spanish professor and is super easy to understand

Richard is great.  He genuinely tries to make class enjoyable and succeeds at it.  He's pretty funny and does a great job at explaining things.  He is a more than fair grader with the writing and speaking components.  I would definitely recommend him to anyone regardless of your spanish level.

I came into the class with almost no idea about Spanish history, cultures and arts but I have gained much more knowledge since learning with him. He is laid back, helpful, compassionate and assign readings for us to understand lessons. I can't wait to give him a big hug! Wish my ECE department had someone like him to lecture me!

Henricksen is fair. The grading is consistent and let's you know exactly what needs to be fixed in the rewrites. You have to stay on top of readings. He's a nice guy and tries to be fun and relatable, although he's not. If you need help reach out and he'll do his best.

It was her 1st time teaching, and it was bad. We rushed through the material and had to teach ourselves. she has a good personality but not with your grade suffering. She lied about certain things being on the final when it was something completely different. Tests weigh a lot and determine grades.

0/10 do not recommended. He is not understanding at all & can fail at the end of the term by dropping your grade over attendence. Every missed lecture is 4% off your final grade & he does not care to work around your schedule outside of his class. He thinks his class is the only one your taking.

He was nice in class, but very inconsiderate about grades and attendance. Grade received could have been higher if he didn't make a big deal about rounding 0.05%, unlike the other spanish professors I've had at OSU.

Mara was an amazing Spanish teacher. There was definitely a lot of assignments during the week, but they never took me more than an hour or so to complete. Participating and actively speaking, as is with all foreign languages, is the easiest way to be successful in this class
Took him during COVID and I have never been more stressed out taking a class. Zoom classes were mandatory and he was not understanding about anything.

I absolutely LOVED Prof. Mara. He is incredibly considerate with disability accommodations and will be more than happy to help you outside of class. If you're debating on taking Spanish courses, go for Prof. Mara. He gives a lot of homework, but for good reason. The practice will be incredibly useful.

He is just really caring and just a really good person. He is really good at explaining different concepts in Spanish and he is very understanding of the fact that some concepts are confusing. The class overall is extremely easy if you have experience in Spanish. I easily got all of my work for the week done in an hour.

I had Prof. Mara during Covid, so I know that I didn't technically get him during the best time for a class that involves a solid amount of communication. However, professor Mara did what he could to make the class fun and is obviously very caring for his students. You can tell that he wants to help everyone, and really makes the class interesting.

Mara is a really good professor, and he made Spanish 3 easy. There are only a few homework assignments that are graded for completion on Carmen. I turned some in late and still got full credit. He is very reasonable when you reach out to him for feedback or extensions on assignments. The quizzes and exams were pretty easy and they were open note

Professor Mara is amazing! I took spanish 1103 online with him and it was easy, but I truly think that I learned a lot from him. He's so helpful, and he is understanding of mistakes and helps you to correct them. I loved his class, and I would definitely recommend his class!

Professor Mara is my favorite Spanish professor at OSU. He genuinely wants and expects students to learn Spanish but also maintains a relaxed attitude in lecture.  He also has very clear and understandable views on fairness in the classroom and in grading. If you have to take Spanish 3, Mara is a very good choice.

I really liked him. I have always struggled in Spanish but this is the easiest foreign language class I have taken (even compared to my high school Spanish classes). He is a funny, likable professor and he creates a very comfortable and casual learning environment. Participation is a big part of your grade! Only 1-2 homework assignments weekly.

He really made the class fun and simple. By showing up to class, you guaranteed yourself that you would learn some helpful mnemonic or bit of information that just stuck. His teaching style was very engaging, so expect to partake in games twice a week. He also genuinely enjoyed teaching and that rubbed off on you; you enjoyed going to Spanish class

Took individualized spanish with him. Sounds difficult but super easy. Homework can be done in 4 hours for a whole module. His oral exams can be prepped for, just memorize a script. He grades really easily and he is nice and helpful. Life saver and best teacher you can have.

Tested into the class from highschool. Hate spanish but he made it bearable. I am absolutely terrible at Spanish but I got a B+ even with a 2% deduction (university foreign language attendance policy). He is funny and caring. He calls on people at random but won't make a fool out of you. He grades pretty easy as well. especially on oral exams
Very helpful and active in the class and out, engaging, makes the class interesting. If you do the work, you'll get an A. Definitely a teacher I'd recommend.

He grades easily and the tests are pretty straightforward. Very helpful in understanding the language. Oral exams are really easy too with simple formats. You have to go to class though because of the University's attendance policy for a foreign language. I would recommend this class for an easy A.

I retook this class for grade forgiveness after a very bad experience with another professor and Prof. Hawkins is just a ball of sunshine. She's so encouraging and makes class fun and informative. She is super accessible and just so so nice. The only downside is the bajillion assignments a week, but that's the department's doing.

Kristin was absolutely wonderful. She was funny, engaging, and always laughing. The class felt light and comfortable and she was always willing to help. Super organized and had literally EVERYTHING you could ever need on Carmen.
Kristin was a great professor! She really cared about her students and made her class fun. She was always incredibly helpful when you asked. I definitely recommend taking her class!

Kristin is awesome! She really cares about your success and will do everything to help you. She is full of energy, entertaining, and always well prepared. Would definitely recommend taking her for Spanish.

The class was relatively boring since I probably should have been taking 1103 and didn't really learn anything new. That said, she could not have made class more enjoyable for me. Very interested in students' success, but I'm not sure I would want to take her for the course if I didn't already know the verbs pretty well.

Kristin was a great professor! If you ever needed help with anything she was easy to reach either by email or during office hours. She made the class a breeze. I would definitely recommend her as a professor for spanish!

Simply, the best teacher you could have for a Spanish class. Kristin is super energetic and helpful and her classes are really engaging and - dare I say it - fun! You'll have a hard time falling asleep in class. Spanish is not my forte, but she makes it easy to learn.
Kristin is a GREAT teacher!  I had her class at 9:00am and she kept us awake and interested. Recommend taking her if you have the option.

Professor Hawkins is without a doubt the best teacher I have ever had.  She is always energetic and not afraid to be silly in class which always makes for an interesting class.  She loves to help students and truly wants you to succeed.  She teaches the material very well and definitely prepares you well for exams.
One of the best teachers I've ever had! Super nice and energetic no matter what. Makes you feel comfortable with speaking a foreign language. Class is relatively easy with her as a teacher.

A great professor! She is so nice and always in a great mood. Makes it easy to meet the people around you and enjoy being in class. Grades fairly easy and presents relevant information during class time.

She is the greatest professor.  Hands down.  Take Spanish with her if you can!!  I know I'm definitely trying to finish out the sequence with her...  She is understanding that Spanish is not our native language (mostly), and grades easily!   AWESOME.
Great teacher!!!! She grades hard but fair. If you need help she will help, she came in on day off many times to help me and a couple other people.
Such a good teacher. Prepares you well for the exams, plays games in class. Her personality is contageous! i miss her, not only as an instructor, but also as a person. makes spanish easy!!

Kristin is probably one of the greatest professors I've had at OSU. She is super clear with all of her instructions and she always knows how to make the class seem somewhat interesting, even if the material is boring. Overall a good class with an amazing instructor.  If you get the option, schedule with her before someone else does. (:
great teacher, gives a reasonable amount of homework and is always giving helpful tips for the tests. i would recommend you take her over anyone else

Kristin is awesome! Take her if you get a chance! She is so upbeat and helpful. Her spirit is contagious(:  She makes class fun, and is always willing to help. I am still using worksheets and charts she prepared for us. I wish I could take her for every Spanish class I have to take.

Class was super fun, and fast paced. Kristin is always well prepared, fun, and able to answer any questions. The tests were fairly easy, too. Just be ready to have one over two chapters every other week, as well as several oral exams.

Kristin is one of the best professors I've ever had at OSU. She is always very well prepared for class and has fun activities planned for each section. She is very nice, easy to talk to, and genuinely cares about her students. She is a very fair grader and clearly explains everything. I would definately recommend taking Spanish with Kristin.

Kristin is awesome! She is super nice, and very friendly!! She makes class actually worth going to because shes always in a good mood and trying to make everyone have a good time. Would highly recommend her to anyone, annd she even grades nice :) Take her if you can!!
great teacher and entertaining class. we all learned so much and kristin is super helpful and kind all the time :) highly suggest taking her class

Kristin is a great professor with an awesome ability to keep students engaged. She plans many fun activities during class and she is extremely helpful if you need extra help. She prepares you well for both her exams and for Spanish speaking in general. One of the best professors I've had - Thanks Kristin!

Prepares you well for exams, but seems to be a tough grader.  There are weekly quizzes that are pretty easy over the stories and they prepare you for the exams. Make sure you go beyond the minimum requirements on essays and projects to get a high grade.  Class is fun and she brought food in every time we watched a little video.
Kristin is an awesome teacher.  She knows her stuff and she is very funny and enthusiastic.  She is always willing to help and grades very fairly. I definitely recommend taking her if you can.

Kristin is awesome. She made me want to continue with spanish. She met with me many times and she also gives "hw passes" which are great. She is prob one of the best teachers I've had. Very fun and loves what she does. Take her if you can.
She is a very entusiastic teacher and knows her stuff. She does not make the class harder than it has to be but she does keep the class involved. She is very helpful and very nice.

She is very nice, helpful, and all-around one of the best spanish teachers I have ever had.She has many activities for class which keep you awake and she is REALLY nice. She's willing to work with you so that you can succeed.
amazing spanish teacher. great sense of humor. makes class interesting and fun to go to. very helpful and available whenever. i recommend everyone takes her for spanish!!!

she is the BEST spanish teacher!!!! super nice, really funny, definately willing to help, makes class fun with lots of games, and teaches the material really well so you actually understand it. if you have to take spanish, take it with her!!
great teacher.  hilarious sense of humor.  will bend over backwards to help or explain anything.  i wish she was teaching 104
so helpful, and makes class fun.
Probably the worst teacher in the department.  Highly pretentious and not worth taking a class with.
She freakin rocked...wish I could stay with her in my next spanish classes

Very nice, always willing to help students. For our speaking evaluation she definitely graded lightly. A fun class - she brought us candy a few times and even made us brownies at the end of the quarter.
Kristin was a really great teacher. She has a lot of energy and makes getting all those attendence points not so bad. She is cool with grades too.

Oh my gosh.  Best teacher I've had in ANY of my classes EVER.  So helpful, she is so understanding and won't make you do things that she thinks are unneccesary.  She doesn't bow down to the Spanish department - she assigns her own homework (much less than they do!) She is totally awesome and soooo understanding in teaching and grading.

Professor Diaz is funny and understands how to teach the content well, but she is a little judgmental when her students do not participate. She is an easy grader and makes sure her students do well in the class.
Professor was very rude. If the class did not know something she would basically call us lazy.

Professor Diaz is so sweet and understanding. She really wants you to learn and is always willing to help if you dont understand something. Shes also super funny and her lectures are entertaining. The class is easy to get a good grade in because many of the speaking assignments are graded based on participation.
She puts lots of resources online, it is very easy to pass her classes. Fairly light grader.

I was so worried to take Spanish as I am not good at it, but Professor Diaz was amazing! She was funny and made 8am lecture actually enjoyable, as well as being a lenient grader as she understood we were far from fluent in Spanish. Lots of homework, but if you do them it will help boost your grade. Overall, my favorite Spanish teacher I've had.

Profesora Díaz is seriously one of the most caring professors I have ever encountered during my time in college. She truly wants you to do well, and she does everything in her ability to help you succeed. Please try hard in her class and do what you can to make her feel appreciated. She is one of the nicest people I have ever met.

This class was just a lot of busy work imo, it was almost a burden to do every week. I personally don't like OSU's Spanish Dept., but I did like my professor. She's not too charismatic but she really cares about us. She always gives feedback on video assignments and is usually available to answer questions. She also has helpful videos to help study

I took her for online Spanish 3 and it was kind of a lot of work. You have 2 online homework assignments each week, Spanish group/individual videos projects every other week, and a few extra assignments and exams. I'd say the key to this class is staying organized and on top of assignments. Nothing is too hard just do the work and know due dates.

I didn't like her at first because she seemed really boring and uninterested, but she's actually very sweet and cares about her students succeeding. The class is SO easy. Do the homework, show up for class, study the material on the study guides, and you'll pass just fine.

She wasn't always the most charismatic, but she cares about her students. She gets through material in a timely manner, and lets you leave early if she's done. Showing up to class is a major key to success, but as long as you do your homework, attend class, and participate, you should easily succeed in her class.

She doesn't have the most lively personality, but she is super sweet and cares about her students. She gets bored of being in class a lot and would let us go early. There are a couple homework assignments a week that only take a few minutes, plus weekly online homework. Show up to the class and do what you're supposed to and you will do fine.

I really didn't like her in the beginning, but you warm up to her. She cares about her students but is very passive, so she can seem uninterested at times. Like with any language class, homework and attendance are a must, but it's an easy class if you just show up and do your work.
She isn't the most interesting or inspirational teacher, but she hates grading  homework so she rarely assigns it.

Ana is one of the sweetest professors I have had. She makes the class fun and easy, and truly wants the best for her students. She sometimes seems a little uninterested in what she is teaching and is hard to understand at points, but you will warm up to her fast. Be nice to her, and she will be nice back, because she loved our class.

I took this class strictly online but loved it. We had group speaking assignments that were relatively easy and everything was due weekly on sundays. Exams were not terrible and he always kept the class interesting.

I had Professor Valencia for 1103. I took it online and he was able to keep it engaging and funny. Lots of work on PearsonMyLab and with various zooms that required you to talk in Spanish but overall they were easy. Get every easy point you can so you can have a cushion for the harder assignments.

Professor Valencia was one of the best Spanish instructors. Always willing to answer questions and help his students learn in the best way they could. Would highly recommend taking Spanish 3 from him.

Valencia is an amazing Spanish 1103 professor. He genuinely cares about his students and responds pretty fast outside of class. He has a lot of quizzes and exams (almost one every week), but he grades very fairly and gives generous curves. The class was asynchronous, so we only met once a week over Zoom and Valencia does cold call on people.

She's a good professor and makes room for questions when things are unclear. Also super funny. I will say though, she can come across as condescending when talking about your Spanish and is a pretty tough grader when it comes to papers. If you show up to class and put effort into your work, you'll be fine.

She was very passive aggressive and didn't treat us like independent adults. She forced you into group work and would hover just to jump in and correct mid thought. Her grading was so tough and nit-picky. Her class made me hate Spanish. I cringed every time I walked in. Definitely would not take again.

She is a great teacher and even though there are times I can zone out, the way she teaches the Spanish draws you back into the lesson. Be prepared for a lot of assignments throughout the week as well as mandatory class participation

Prof. Stuessy does fine. She engages with her students and seems to really care that we understood the material, but there was a lot of busy work that barely contributed to actual understanding but really impacted grades. She was always accommodating when it came to technical issues, but you have to put a good amount of effort in to do well.

Great woman, while there are many assignments online they're pretty small and you can redo the questions over and over until you get a 100. Tests are important and proctored! The only hard part is the exams but the study guide tells you exactly what each section will be looking for.

One big thing for Señora Stuessy is participation you could pronounce everything wrong but as long as you constantly raise your hand and participate, youre gonna do well. There are small homework assignments everyday, but they are not too hard and they help you study for the exams.

I was always anxious and embarrassed when I messed up during this class. Professor Stuessy can be condescending and didn't explain things in a different way when struggling. She gives out a LOT of work. The lectures and weekly homework didn't help but attendance and participation is graded. Not very accommodating if you have life issues.

Cried after the first lecture b/c of how anxious this class made me. Professor Stuessy is a bit condescending and makes you feel unintelligent when struggling with a topic. I've taken a lot of Spanish classes in my life and I have never felt this discouraged. Also, get ready for a LOAD of work, most work out of all my courses, and its only a GE

Overall Professor Stuessy is a good teacher but I do not recommend her for online classes. She is not empathetic towards her students and does not work with them while in the middle of a pandemic. If you have other life priorities besides school, I would not take her. She also issues an INSANE amount of work, more than any of my classes.

Very typical for OSU Spanish dept. She really cares for her students and is super accessible and eager to help. Appreciates participation. Attendance is mandatory, as is typical for this course. If you put in the work in class and study for exams, you will do well.

Sra. Stuessy was very nice. She genuinely wanted her students to succeed and never got frustrated if the class was confused about a difficult topic. Be sure to do all of your homework, it greatly affects your grade.
Professor Stuessy is super sweet and wants her students to do well. I learned a lot from her and enjoyed the class.

Great teacher and cares about students! She loves when you participate in class and gives a lot of homework. However, this is good because lots of your grade comes from these two things rather than being test-heavy. She takes her time to clearly answer questions. Some topics are a little confusing (not hard though) and she prepares you well.

Stuessy was great. She's so sweet and really wants students to do well. She's a fair grader, and she provides lots of study materials. Generally, concepts are introduced via the textbook, and she reviews it in depth and answers questions. She also values participation, but she doesn't care if your Spanish sucks. It's great for practicing speaking.

It's a smaller class so you have to show up, but she's really good at explaining the content and genuinely cares about her students. Easy to access outside of class. She doesn't show favorites to the people who are better at Spanish, and she'll make sure everyone understands a topic before moving on. Definitely recommend!

She was very nice and you could tell she wanted all of her students to succeed. Yes, participation counts, but as long as you say one thing per class you'll do fine. She sometimes mixed things up in her presentations, but she always caught it and it was easy to understand. There is weekly and nightly homework, but it was very manageable.

I really liked Professor Stuessy. She was really sweet and genuinely cared about her students, very funny too. She could be a little forgetful sometimes and it could make things unclear but she always caught it and fixed it. I learned a lot from this class and it really wasn't much harder than 1103.

Patricia is really nice and very understanding, and pretty funny (kind of in the way you make fun of your mom for doing something ridiculous). yes, participation matters and lecture is mandatory but that is Spanish departmnt policy - not really her control. You definitely need to be proficient in spanish to do well.

This was my first college-level Spanish class after four years of high school Spanish, and I found it to be a pretty easy transition. If you took AP Spanish, you should have no trouble. Prof. Stuessy is really nice and funny, and if you show up regularly and do your homework, you will be completely fine.

I took Spanish 2202 with Sra. Stuessy. For context, I'm a Spanish minor and took AP in high school, and took 1103 here the previous semester. Sra. Stuessy is nice and can be helpful. The class itself isn't difficult, just make sure to do the homework online and in person for easy points. The concepts are similar to what is learned in AP Spanish.

She didn't explain things well and made us learn almost everything from the book instead. A lot of homework daily and weekly. A lot of class participation necessary. The lectures weren't helpful but attendance is mandatory if you want a decent grade.

Lecture heavy on grammar & semantics but not much practice on using that kind of spanish in assignments. A lot of homework was on Mexican & Puerto Rican culture which often took a lot of time to do. Be prepared for homework

Dr. Foulis does an amazing job with this course! I took it in the fall and despite it being completely virtual I still had a great experience. Dr. Foulis also went out of her way for us so that we could meet in person a couple of times. I would say she is a fair grader, but if there is something you are unsure about just ask her!

Dr. Foulis is caring and pushes students to do their best work. She was responsive to emails and willing to help outside of class, especially because the content of her class was difficult. She gives great instructions for assignments and assigns interesting readings and films. I recommend her!

She's a great professor and really cares about helping her students. Quizzes can be pretty difficult because of how much material you have to study for on them, but shes a pretty fair grader when it comes to the papers
Ella es una professora excelente. Es simpática y su clase es muy interes-nte.
Course is challenging but she is receptive to students who put in the extra effort. Somewhat unorganized, would cancel office hours without notifying the class.
She was easy to understand and really helpful
Decent teacher.
Nice teacher and very helpful.
not a bad teacher just has a bad subject, made 104 bearable with not so hard exams and easy quizes

She is great. Truly cares about the students learning and works to get everyone involved. REALLY good at explaining concepts. The tests are sort of hard but all classes take the same test and she does a really god job preparing students

Very nice professor! She's always happy and pleasant. Her class is very fair and pretty easy if you just put in a little but of studying. She prepares you for tests very well and class can even be fun sometimes!
Elena is a wonderful teacher. But on top of that,her personality is always pleasant, which helps when you have to come to class every day. GREAT instructor.

Foulis is a wonderful  teacher!! she is really good at what she does and she knows the material. She is very interested in helping students learn and understand the material. also she is a kind and just a great person
Very helpful & very nice. Good teacher.

if you need help she gives you help. you need to actually attempt to try in that class and she will give you all the help you need. dont fool around. its easy. just pay attention a little bit. she is really nice.

I had Professor Vieira for SPAN1103 and she is an amazing professor! She made learning Spanish easy and fun. The exams were dense and difficult, but she prepares her students really well for them. She genuinely cares for her students and is very understanding. I enjoyed her class!
Dr. Vieira is the most understanding professor Ive ever had. Shes very sweet, flexible, and chill. You can tell she cares a lot about her students.

Extremely accessible outside of class. Material is challenging because learning a new language is challenging, there's LOTS of homework but Proffesora Viera is available to meet outside of class as many times as you need. She is a very humane grader as well - she deeply wants her students to succeed!
Likes talking about her kids and showed us pictures. From South America and does a lot of exercises from the textbook. She is really flexible and is not a difficult grader

Monica was so sweet and genuinely wanted to help all of us. She gave clear examples and grades very fairly. She made sure everyone understanded her, since the class was all in spanish, and encouraged us to speak even if our spanish wasn't very accurate. She was an amazing teacher and I would definately recommend her for Spanish 3401.

Monica is very kind and tried her best to teach, but was ultimately unsatisfactory. Unable to simplify the material or answer the questions of a Spanish I course. Also took forever to grade assignments and lectures were not helpful. Attendance is mandatory but class was usually a waste of time, just learn material from textbook.

DO NOT TAKE CLASS WITH MONICA. She is very kind but is not a good professor. No one ever understood what was going on in class. I took her Spanish 1 class and the entire thing was about grammar, which is too advanced for people who don't even know basic vocab. If you want to actually learn Spanish, do so with a different professor.

Dr. Gozalo-Salellas was so nice and his lectures were engaging. You need to do the readings and watch assigned videos in order to understand whats going on in class, but thats as hard as it gets. We had a midterm exam which wasnt very hard, and a final paper. He is very understanding and available to meet outside of class if you ask

I cant say enough about how wonderful Ignasi is. His class was always super engaging and discussions were always interesting and never felt like lectures. Ignasi was my favorite spanish professor I had at Ohio State. The course work is very manageable and I really learned a lot about Spain and film. I highly recommend his class!

Ignasi is such a great professor! His class is very fun and interesting, and his passion shines through to make the class more interactive. I learned so much from his class and did not feel like I had to do a ton of extra work. My writing improved and I really enjoyed getting to know such a helpful and caring, prof. in the Spanish dept.

Oihane is super nice and does everything she can to see her students succeed. The topics covered in pronunciation were interesting and she teaches it in a way that is easily understood by students. She gives amazing feedback and is always available outside of class for extra help. I wish I could take another class of hers!

I took this class online over the summer. It was extremely fast and a ton of work. She would conference call with me at least once a week to explain difficult topics. She truly cared about her students understanding. Tests were nothing crazy, but you actually need to do the work to do well on them. She was one of the best professors I've had.

I took this class because I am pursuing a spanish minor. So far 3201, 3203, & 3450 have all been a breeze to me as a native speaker and received an A easily. This class was very different than what I expected - its A LOT of memorization and application. Bc I took this class over summer, it was even worse. Im sure its fine in a normal semester

Oihane is so so so sweet and her class was so interesting.  pronunciation is by no means a blowoff class, but if you put in the work, you can get an A. none of her grading is ambiguous and she really does want to see you succeed. she knows what she is talking about and was an excellent teacher.
If I could I would take it again.
She's super nice I would take her class again if I could.
Nice guy, really cares about his students, but you really wont learn much. It is an easy A if you put in a very very small amount of effort (ie show up)

Ramon was a great professor, super friendly and very understanding to non-native speakers. Super nice and knowledgeable to his field. He was also a pretty easy grader. As long as you actually are trying, he'll give you a good grade. If you have the opportunity to take him, take him.
Very nice guy. A little bit weird, but fun.
Participation matters a lot.
Great guy. Funny, very inspirational. You're going to learn a lot.
Super nice guy, very easy grader. You won't learn much, and the classes can be annoyingly repetitive, but it's an easy A for minimal effort.

Elena is one of the nicest professors I've had, and she has a real passion for teaching and the Spanish language. But she's a very tough graders and expects a lot more than the work you'd give to any regular GE class. If you take this class be prepared to work on every aspect of your Spanish. Definently not easy, but shes an amazing person!

I enjoyed Elena's class, despite the subject matter of Spanish verb tenses. There is a group project about dialects from different countries that she grades rather seriously, so don't blow that off. HW assignments that require some work but aren't brain busters. Exams were pretty standard for a language class in my opinion. Not easy, not too hard.

This class was harder than a GE should have been She skips around the chapters and doesn't explain much. The tests she makes are really hard to study for, since the outlines seem to be different. Homework only hurts your grade, it doesn't help it. She's nice and is a native spaniard, but I wouldn't take the class again.

She was a solid choice for 1103. She is a native speaker, which personally, really helped me learn Spanish. However, she does make her quizzes different and include more difficult things than other 1103 professors, such as a 20 point, all written with no word bank culture section. She is understanding and very sweet.

She does a very good job at teaching and I feel like I learned but the class was too difficult for not only myself. The homework is very difficult and offers no credit for few errors. The tests are graded heavily and sometimes you will not have all of class to work on it. The big grade booster, MyLabs, only offer 3 tries to pass as well.
Midterm and Final is very challenging, but everything else, if you work for it, should go well. Very nice professor as well!

Would have gotten an A but i was lazy and didn't do a couple homeworks which end up being a huge chunk of your grade. Easy and fun class to go to. Lots of class participation and joking around. I had a lot of fun Way easier than 240. The SLRPE is not hard but you do have to studyI recommend listening to entrevista's (interviews in spanish) on utube

She's very nice. You really should participate though, because if not the class will suck. Also, if you take this class, stop whining. Spanish is just as much of a class as any other, so just do your work and be happy that you have a very good professor and can easily pull off an A if you try.

Amazing prof. Ridiculously enthusiastic and it is clear that she is very passionate about what she teaches. Definitely take a class with her if you have the chance. Readings could take a while but she doesn't collect homework and she gives you a study guide for what's going to be on her exams so it's super straight forward.
Great, caring professor. Class is difficult, lots of reading. Exams aren't bad though. I'd recommend her!

Dra. Ana is an incredible teacher. Definitely try to have her because you'll learn so much more and love going to class because she makes it interesting. She is very passionate about Spanish literature and you can see that in how she teaches. If you need help, she gives it 110%. A really good prof.
Very helpful
Great teacher! Very enthusiastic. Doesnt collect homework everyday. Always willing to help. Prepares students well for the test and truly wants them to do well.

One of those professors good to the point where if you messed up  on something or don't understand something, you know that it's your own problem and not a fault of her teaching. Great teacher + great person.

Dr. E.-Morales was the best Spanish teacher that I have ever had. She was very passionate about the class and she was an excellent teacher. I learned more in one quarter with her than in 5 years of High School Spanish. If you go to all of the classes and pay attention, studying is not really necessary.She prepares you well for every test. Fabulous!

He really cares about the subject and my class loved him. We always had a good laugh and good discussions. Attendance is mandatory and so is reading. We had new readings due every class, but it was fine as long as you stay on top of your stuff. Go into the class with an open mind and good attitude and you'll be fine!

Hes a great teacher and I feel has one of the most clear accents in the spanish department. The class was Bolivian Culture so a majority of the readings were 1800 and 1900s stuff that gave historical context in a story format. I enjoy most of them and feel like I've learned a lot about culture already. Aside from reading the novel, its easy.

The class has 3 short essays and 1 final research paper for the semester. Expect pop quizzes over the reading on average every other class but they're five questions over the super super basic stuff such as author, basic plot, etc. He's super adorable. Attendance is "mandatory" in that he doesn't take attendance but you can't make up missed a quiz

He's a really nice guy, but the class was almost impossible to understand. Struggled every day with readings, which were mostly 19th-century stuff. Hard. Not necessarily in the "good, challenging" way.

Once a week we had to watch a film and read a text that accompanied it. All of the movies and texts are supplied by Olivia on Carmen. She followed the syllabus completely so there were no discrepancies on due dates or assignments. She is a young professional that loves group/class discussions, hearing other viewpoints, and helping students excel.
