Lots of discussions about the films. Some were watched in class, others had to be viewed on your own time. A LOT of pop quizzes but overall a great professor and a relatively easy class. The material was content heavy and interesting. Little notes were taken, no tests, just papers. Make sure you READ the material & watch the films.

One of the most considerate professors. Idk how many times she asked " do we need to push the due date back? Would that make it less stressful?". Forget your homework? Be honest and she'll most likely let you turn it in next class. Accidently said "I'm pregnant" instead of "I'm embarrassed"? No pasa nada. Ella comprende. Will give you that A- tho

Kristina is so nice and friendly.  I thought I would dread this class as I was only taking it because it was required, but she made it quite bearable.  She said it "wasn't a guaranteed A" but I got an A anyway.  Very helpful prof and does what she can to make class manageable at 8 a.m.

She is very nice and very understanding. Do all the homework because it is really worth a lot. After conversing with friends she is a very critical Test grader. It's literally impossible for anyone to achieve a 100% on a test. So if you want an easy A, probable shouldn't take her.
she's the best spanish teacher i've had. she grades fair, but if you participate in class she usually rounds up for you. she's also very easily accessible and wants her students to succeed.

LOVED this class. Super easy A. If you do homework, it's a lot of free points cause she grades for completion.  Lots of group discussion activities. VERY easy grader, super approachable, understanding, and quick to respond to emails. She's probably the nicest teacher at OSU and she really loves teaching. Only complaint was that it was way too easy!

I highly recommend taking Spanish from Kristina.  She is genuinely interested in her students, both those who are great at Spanish and those who are terrible.  She is probably my favorite teacher so far at OSU.
most amazing teacher I've ever had. Wish I could have her again, was super understanding when I had to be out sick and missed a ton of class

If you have to take spanish, you'll want to have Kristina. She is so kind, understanding and a VERY fair grader. She's enthusiastic in her teaching and keeps class interesting. I had the class five days a week and was never absent. I would highly recommend her. (Even if you're really bad at spanish!)

Such a great teacher! Her kindness and constant smile made class worth coming to. She was always working harder to make everyone in her class engaged, smarter, and excited to learn Spanish. Homework for completion every night but it only takes 20 minutes and her quiz/test grading is fair. Highly recommend her to anyone!
So helpful. Such a sweetheart. Wish I could take her for all my spanish classes!
Kristina rocks hardcore. REALLY helpful, and let us out of class early pretty much every day. SOOOO nice, wish I could have her for all of my Spanish classes!
should use pokemon more in examples
Class may be boring if you already speak Spanish well.  Daily group activities and she likes to call on people.
So much fun!! I love kristina!! I would take her for all my spanish classes-- very understanding and helpful!
Awesome teacher!! Very Helpful! Fun class!
No Comments
best spanish teacher ever! looked forward to class everyday. Lots of fun. Very nice.
She makes spanish really fun. Easy to understand, speaks slowly. Extremely nice and helpful. Love her!

Doctor Rutherford made me fear going to Spanish... she was easy to get in contact with, but would not always respond to emails and often wait until projects or assignments were already turned in to answer questions about them. She was understanding to an extent, but also could be very easily angered. You'll either love her or hate her.
She is genuinely incredible. I have always been bad at spanish but she makes the class extremely manageable. She is not a tough grader AT ALL. She always tries to smile. 10/10 absolutely.
I do not know why would people think she is a tough grader. She is that kind of professor who is not trying to fail her students. She is very chilled!
Too hard to say
The worst of the worst in the worst around the worst. If one slogan can reflect her, it would be Truly Worst
Just find another professor.

The beginning of the semester she is very nice, like an angel from Victoria Secret Angels. Then, she started to change in the middle of it, like Darth Vader from Star Wars (worst version). Just be very careful because she can rip you life off like finger tip. For the love of God, avoid her and please take another instructor.

Sometimes nice, but most of the time she was very cruel. Literally cruel like Cruela de Vil. She always try to mess up your grades and even makes you feel miserable with your grades by giving you less credits in certain assignments. Just think ten times if she appeared to be your professor (I mean your witch)

I guess I am not the only one who got mad at her, well she is not deserve to be called as a professor. She always promised everyone she is not going to be strict in her grading, but she did it anyway. Then, she always try to force everyone to learn by themselves, which is crazy. Guys, if you want to save your grade, please find another instructor.

She was unwilling to meet outside of class or work with disability accommodations, reprimanded students for using computers, though most students have the e-book. Hw often unrelated to the material, seemed to confuse our class with courses she was teaching at another school. Seemed overworked to the point if impacted performance as an instructor

Jessica Rutherford is possibly the most approachable professor I've had. She's very nice, and pretty flexible with the due dates. Her grading is fair (often very generous), but the midterms and finals are long. (She can't change them though, since they're for all the Spanish classes.) I was so nervous for this class, but it's great!

Jessica cares about her students and their education so much. She genuinely wants to see her students succeed. She doesn't cover all of the content super thoroughly in class, but is always willing to meet with students at different times if need be. Awesome professor, definitely recommend.

Jessica Rutherford was the most caring professor that I had last semester. She genuinely cared about her students and sought to see that they succeeded. She was flexible with due dates, as long as they were done. She went over material multiple times if needed. If you ever have the chance, take her. She is exceptional.

Señora Rutherford was an outstanding professor. She makes learning Spanish so much easier than it seems. She is very accessible and cares about each student individually. Jessica is a wonderful person, teacher and truly an inspiration.

Professor Rutherford was an amazing and inspirational Spanish teacher. She made class fun even at 8am. She was very caring and understanding with deadlines and quizzes. She was always super helpful and generous with points and grading. She was also very accessible in and out of class. I would definitely take her class again.

Jessica is hands down the best professor I've ever had. She really cares about all her students and their success in college and even professional careers. She is very inspirational and goes deeper into cultural aspects of Spanish that the books don't really get to. She is flexible with deadlines but you really have to do the work. She is wonderful

Jessica is a really amazing and totally understanding professor. She is super flexible about deadlines if you really need it and will work with you to make sure you succeed. However, she will actually make you work for it so you do have to do the work. But she's funny and amazing and one of the best Spanish teachers I've ever had.
Class is all in Spanish and although she speaks quickly sometimes the accent and whatnot is not difficult to understand at all.  Tests are somewhat difficult but manageable with studying
Great teacher. Easy on the eye too.
Really nice and easy on the eye.

I just had this teacher for SPANISH 104 and she was extremely helpful and truly wanted everyone to succeed. If someone was unclear about something she wouldn't move on until they understood it. If you have to take 104, get Rutherford.

I had her for 103.66. I felt as though she really wanted our class to succeed and was happy to help us, but she was not lenient in her grading, even with the oral she was very nit picky. Overall a good teacher, but you have to be good at spanish to excel.

Lisa was an amazing professor! Spanish 1102.01 is pretty much review of high school Spanish, but there is still some work needed for class. She made the class very interactive and was always willing to help. Tests and quizzes were very straightforward from the book. Take this class.

She is kind to students and will do what she can to help you understand the material. I had to miss class for a mandatory event and she met me outside of class time to complete the listening test. I took this course freshmen year and I probably could have gotten an A if I had put more effort into studying.

Prof. Green was a great teacher for Spanish 3. She was knowledgable, helpful, and accessible at all times. The format for grading is set out by the Spanish department but she is a generous grader. Pay attention and do the assignments, it will be an easy A. She is a good person and genuinely cares about her students in and out of the classroom.

Prof Green (Verde) was probably my favorite Spanish professors at Ohio State. She is chill and pretty lenient on grading. She is also super understanding and keeps class fun. Attendance is mandatory because you only get a certain number of skips (without penalty) per semester, but she sometimes ends class early too.
Such a sweet lady. Genuinely cares about her students and wants them to learn. Take her class if you can!

Profe Verde is an awesome Spanish professor. Spanish 1101 is admittedly a bit boring, but she does her best to make it enjoyable by incorporating group work and fun days where you learn about the culture. She's super sweet and prepares you well for the exams.

If you have the chance to take Profe Green, DO IT! She is the greatest professor in the Spanish Department. She is very helpful and will take time out of her day to help you. I had her my first semester at OSU and couldn't ask for a better professor. You need to complete MyLab, but you do NOT need to buy the book. She prepares you for every exam.
Great professor, especially for those that have trouble with languages/Spanish. She's always willing to help and an easy grader.

Amazing and cool professor. I took this class because I had to for a GE req. and thought I would dread it because I didn't care for learning a new language. This was not the case, as Profe Green truly understood that 1101.01 was intro level, and ran the course as such. Easy A, and she is very flexible in accommodating matters to your best interest

Definitely a solid choice for Spanish, it was my second semester in Spanish at Ohio State, and she definitely was very understanding and cared about the students. Taught in a way that helped me understand material well.

Just show up and talk occasionally and you'll pass. Easier than high school Spanish and she's a great professor. She let me make up my quiz and gives good feedback. Really easy grader and gave optional homework at the end of the semester to make up points.

Profe Green is so understanding. I had the same Spanish teacher in high school for 4 years, so I was unsure how well I would adjust to a new teacher. Profe Green exceeded my expectations and more. Even though it was her first semester, she was such a great teacher! She makes Spanish interesting and is extremely knowledgeable.

I'm awful at spanish and should've dropped to a lower class, but thankfully Profe Green worked well with me to make things easier. She also grades very leniently if she knows you tried your hardest. She's overall very sweet and helpful.

I loved Profe Green! She is so sweet and genuinely cares about her students. The lectures aren't always the most entertaining due to the material but she does a good job of teaching it. She is always willing to meet with students outside of class or at office hours if they need help on anything.
I thought he was kind of rude to students. I was very sick and he wouldn't let me reschedule an exam even though I had a doctor's note. His lectures were also incredibly boring.

Prof. Davis is incredibly unprepared and goes off on tangents about unrelated topics. She is the most subjective grader I've encountered and will grade you based on if she likes you. The rudest professor I've had. Our presentations were to last 15 minutes, and students were standing up there for 50 because she kept interrupting. Do not take at all.

I know some students who had different experiences when interacting with her, but aside from comments here and there, she was nice overall. It was a fairly simple class, just reading and discussing it in class. Not entirely clear with guidelines for presentations and what to study for exams. Participation is graded as is with other Spanish classes.

Dr. Davis has created a classroom environment completely conducive to learning, and she is so clearly passionate about teaching their interests and field of study to the students. Yes, you have to participate. Yes, you have to read a lot, but it all feels appropriate to the class. If you do these things, you will get a good grade.

Assignment guidelines are sooo unclear and they change constantly. She is very demanding for participation but spends all of discussion time talking at us. She wastes a lot of class time with introductions and is super disorganized. She is often late or not available for office hours. She is kind of a tough grader. Does not give good feedback.

Halfway through the semester, we had a rep from the Spanish department come listen to our MANY complaints. This class is seriously the most unnecessarily difficult and disorganized course I've ever encountered at this school. Oh, and shy people, get ready to be called out in class because you don't feel comfortable talking! That's loads of fun!

No prep for the midterm essay questions, at all. You'll read 60+ pages per week and God only knows what the takeaway or bottom line is. (Or if it's ever mentioned again.) Every class is 1hr 10min of spurious chit-chat. If you're lucky, she MIGHT mention something noteworthy within the final 10min as you're packing up to leave. Or not. Usually not.

One of the rudest and most condescending professors I've ever had. She was unclear in almost all assignments, and did not give helpful feedback. Talked to the class like she was above everyone, and was very biased when it came to grading. I would not take another class with her

She is rude and condescending. Consistently gives unclear directions for assignments, saying we can figure out for ourselves what page to read to. Doesnt give helpful feedback or hand back assignments. Expects everyone to be jumping for joy about reading Golden Age lit. Doesnt utilize technology well. Gives daily lectures about how bad our work is

She expects a lot of of you, even for an honors class. The readings are usually 50-60 pgs and she expects you to be able to remember details from it during class. However, she isn't picky about your grammar when you speak and she is genuinely interested in helping you and giving feedback. She did assign 8 novels and we only read parts of a 5

She had very unrealistic expectaions of us.  She acted like we should be able to analyze the material like a professional without any prior experience.  The class was loosely structured and as a class we were often clueless as to what he had to do.  She strayed from the syllabus a lot.  I wouldn't recommend her.

When asked for guidance on a paper her immediate reaction was "Im not going to write it for you"! Shows her presumption that all students are lazy and maniupulative.  Of course Im not going to ask her to write it for me! It was an college honors class.  She is so so rude. Worst teacher I have EVER had!

I literally just got an email from this professor while sitting here doing my homework for the class.  She just completely changed the assignment and I have to read the first section of a novel while already halfway through a play. Class is tomorrow. Aka doesn't stick to any form of even an oral syllabus.  STAY AWAY! GET OUT WHILE YOU CAN!

AVOID THIS CLASS! I went into this class knowing that their would be a lot of reading (obviously), but I would have never imagined it to be this hard. Quizzes once a week on the previous material were close to impossible. The midterm contained questions that were so ridiculously vague that you couldn't even begin to come up with an answer.

Worst teacher ever. She's very rude and only likes things her way. Don't make any noise in class. Even if you don't do anything wrong she might still hate you anyways. Very unreasonable and finicky. She picks her favorites and sticks with them. I was really excited about reading this book (Don Quijote) and she ruined a classic for me.
She had no idea what she was doing and was somewhat rude to students.
worst teacher Ive had by far at college.
Lots of work and reading in this class. Tests were hard and she expected way too much. Also pretty rude to students

Spanish 561. Do not take this.  Teacher is very absent minded, rude, and not helpful. She has a huge attitude about everything. I am being completely objective...she knows a lot about Spain but she does not know how to teach well at all. She is not there for students and is a rude person in general. Avoid at all costs, too late for me :(
No Comments
No Comments

She is absolutely a terrible teacher. Doesn't help and doesn't make herself very available to students. She expects way too much from undergraduate students--her expectations are at a graduate level. I'm a student who does all of the assignments and goes above and beyond...or so i thought. i'll be lucky to get a B in this class.

Wow, this lady has energy. She is very funny and very helpful. She is from Colombia and is very friendly. Perfect learning environment and it's very inclusive, she plays videos to help learn and sings songs as well to make it easier to remember. One of my greatest teachers by far.

I took this class my first semester and absolutely loved it! Prof Seiber makes the class really fun and makes it easy to understand the material. If you can get into this class, do it! She is the funniest and most positive professor I have had so far.

Her spanish class was fun and engaging. She usually makes everyone participate and will call on you if you look sleepy or unengaged. Her class was a little disorganized, and the online homework is time-intensive, but both of those problems stem from the spanish department. Overall a very solid choice for intro Spanish.

She made class manageable at 8am. That's when you know. She's a hilarious woman who truly cares whether or not you do well in the class. She is a native Spanish speaker and really knows her stuff. I would definitely take her class if you have a chance. The tests are easy, I looked at my notes for 10 mins before and got an A on the final

Profe Seiber is literally the funniest professor I have, she is a native of Colombia so her accent is just super adorable, and it of course makes her very knowledgeable about spanish. Despite being a fluent spanish speaker she still manages to be a great teacher and not go too fast.

Couldn't ask for a better Spanish professor. If you take Spanish and don't have Seiber, you're doing it wrong!  So helpful, actually cares about her class, learned so much and applied it in a safe, easy-to-grow-in, friendly environment. My Spanish experience at OSU was so so great because of her and I just took it for my language GE req!!!
SHE WAS A BLAST, MADE SPANISH EASY AND FUN

Seiber is the BEST professor! She is so kind and actually really funny! She has a positive, helpful attitude everyday in class. Everyone in my class really liked her. I will be sad if I don't have her again next semester. One example of how awesome she is: she danced to Waka Waka by Shakira in front of the class on the last day. Gotta love her.

Seiber was my favorite professor. She's absolutely hilarious and makes learning Spanish fun. The tests and quizzes are super easy and she's a very easy grader. I'm hoping that I'll have her again in future semesters. By the end of the semester our class felt like a family and I was sad that it was over.
SHE IS THE BEST SPANISH TEACHER EVER. QUIZZESTESTSEXAMS ARE VERY FAIR! Take her!

For lots of majors, this class is required so if you get the opportunity to have Seiber as your professor, take advantage of that! She makes sure everyone understands the material before she moves on and she's actually really funny too.
BEST TEACHER EVER! Highly recommend her. She is very helpful and truly cares for her students.
Very sweet and understanding. We worked in small groups so you get to know the people in your class. Easy grader. Supper nice. Highly recommended
Shes great, she understands how to teach beginner and how to teach heritage speakers.

I absolutely loved her.  I dreaded my spanish classes in high school and was so nervous for this class but she was super laid back. I never felt like she was judging me when I got the wrong answer and she was so funny. I definitely recommend her! I learned more in this class then any other spanish class I've taken.

She was so nice and helpful. She's very easy-going and likes to have regular conversations with the students. I really really liked her. She was so cute when she'd try to speak in English but didn't really have quite right. She's funny and not at all disagreeable. If you get her, you're lucky. She's a fantastic lady.
Love her- shes such a sweetheart, and shes very helpful. As for the books, you need the textbook but not really the workbook- all the answers to homeworks you can find online. :)
She is great. Easy, funny, cares about students, helps out students a lot.
Doesn't have perfect English but she makes it work. And it's funny when she uses wrong phrases.
The best Spanish teacher I have ever had! Very funny and makes the class interesting! Def take her if you can!
This woman is awesome. She's from Colombia which initially intimidated me, but she' amazingly helpful and I learn more with her than any other Spanish teacher.
Very helpful and funny
Shes great, really tries to help the students. highly recommend

Tatiana was a very good teacher. I hadn't taken Spanish in two years when I had her, yet I did well in the class. The class was very fair -- keep up with the work and come to class, and you get a good grade. The tests were reasonable. Tatiana was very nice and helpful.
THE BEST teacher EVER.  Highly recommend.  Teaches you only what you need to know.  Prepares you very well for the exam.

MY MOST FAVORITE TEACHER EVER. I 100%, absolutely, highly recommend.

BEST SPANISH TEACHER EVER.  She was so nice and so helpful!  She taught us everything we needed to know and nothing we didn't.  Let us out of class early all the time.  She's funny and actually made me want to go to class.  This is from someone that HATED spanish.  TAKE HER!!!!!!!!
She is really good. Try to take her for Spanish. She is really nice and always tries to help the students and clearly explains the spanish department format for each exam.
So adorable. Loved her and her class. Pretty basic class if you have taken a spanish class. Works at a decent pace with good exercises. GET HER for a professor!!

She was the best spanish teacher i have ever had. she grades very fairly and prepares the class very well for the exams, in my opinion. She is very nice and made me feel comfortable speaking spanish. She is a native speaker so the only downside is her english, but it doesnt matter.

Tatiana was by far the BEST spanish teacher I have had at Ohio State. I have always struggled with spanish and the quarter with her was great. She made learning fun and simple but still encouraged students to think for themselves. I highly recommend her to anyone!
Tatiana is very easy-going and has a great sense of humor.  Class attendance is mandatory, but that isn't much of a problem since her classes tend to be interesting (or at least not awful.)
She was very helpful and made me feel like I was very capable of understanding/speaking spanish, when in other classes I didn't feel this way. Grades easy and fair. Great professor!
Tatiana is great. She's low-key but humorous. She knows her stuff and does a great job explaining things.
Tatiana is adorable and so nice. She cares about her students' grades. I learned as much in one quarter with tatiana as 4 years of high school spanish.

Tatiana is a great teacher. She is kind and understanding and really wants you to learn Spanish. I don't even like Spanish, but she made the class fun and enjoyable. She is easy-going and funny. Homework if any is easy and the tests aren't bad.

She's a fantastic woman, and really interesting if you speak to her during office hours. Class can become a little unorganized and unclear, but she still does her best to make sure everyone is on the same page and keep it interesting
Really great teacher. Unclear in class when she gets on her tangents, but do the readings, try to comment once or twice every class, and you're pretty much golden.

Fantastic professor! Extremely knowledgeable/smart. Speaks excellent English, a huge plus for office hours. 1 8-page paper, participation points, 1 presentation, nightly h/w (which is nothing more than thinking of a discussion question). A lot of reading but you can get away with skipping a lot, just make sure to participate. Highly recommended!

Chelsea was one of the most caring and understanding professors I've ever had my entire life. The class itself was a higher-level of Spanish and involved a little more critical thinking, which made it tougher, but she was always fair. She related the material well and made it seem important.
Incredible teacher. Very good at explaining Spanish and making activities that help you learn Spanish. My favorite Spanish teacher in my 11 years of Spanish classes
Chelsea was an awesome teacher.  She made it really easy to learn Spanish and was one of the best professors I have ever had.

Caitlin does not know how to teach this class in a fun or engaging way. She talks way too slowly and overly explains simple things. You can definitely get away with not going to class, but going to the exam reviews are helpful.
One of the best at OSU...or as she says "O ese ooo"..has a great attitude bout teaching and makes hilarious jokes...take her class and take advantage of the help she offers during her office hours..
I loved having class with Caitlin, she was very nice and easy to understand.  She cares about how well everyone does in the class which is nice.  I would def take a class with her again!
Great teacher, but there is no way of knowing your grade until it surprises you at the end. I was absolutely sure that I would get an A, but I got a B
Speaks Spanish extremely clearly and has a great attitude toward teaching.
A+ instructor.  She's always happy to help and teaches very well.  I've seen a lot of Spanish instructors and she seems to trump all others.  I hope I can take her for 104.
Caitlin is very nice.  Her class is not hard.  I wouldn't take another class taught by her.  She  was an ok teacher but not the greatest.
The class was pretty easy.  Caitlin was a great teacher.  She is very easy to understand and very helpful. Not to mention she is hot.

Hot teacher, excellent teaching skills. I was just in the wrong place wrong time didnt deserve to be in 103.66 intense review becuase i didnt have spanish for 3 years and somehow tested in it and it was at 8:30 in the morining 5 daysd a week. Yo recomiendo la profesora Caitlin
Ms. Cummings was extremely delightful and a pleasure to watch while teaching.  She is also very knowledgeable on the subject.  Muy excellente.
Excellent instructor!  Very enthusiastic and encouraging!
102.66.  Very good looking instructor and exceptionally helpful.  I was happy to go at 8:30 de la manana.

BEST spanish teacher ever! He is hilarious and makes the class really fun. Easy grading and the class hasn't been hard at all. A few tests, homework assignments every week (but they're easy) and a few projects
Easy grader and laidback. His material is not hard, just spanish in general was hard for me
He is the best. Very funny and makes the class interesting. He cares and gives tips on how to remember the important rules.

Taking Spanish 3 online was the best choice I made so far. The second best would be taking it with Cannon. He was super clear on what needed to be done and often shortened/cut assignments for us. He'd send out a message at the start of each week telling us what we need to do for the week. I probably spent an hour or less on this class per week

Brandon is one of the best teachers I have ever had! Hands down he cares about the students and what he teaches! He makes coming to class fun and I have no idea how he always stays so upbeat! Awesome awesome teacher! Highly recommend taking his classes! Very flexible on grading and always there to help you!

Brandon is one of the best professors here at Ohio State. Hands Down. As long as you participate in class, and pay some amount of attention this class will be a breeze. His teaching style is laid back, and he jokes around a lot during class. But through all that he knows exactly how to teach the material and how to teach it well.

Brandon is the best professor I had this semester. He clearly has a love for the language and enjoys teaching. All you have to do is show up and participate! I studied little for the final and ended up with an A. Brandon really prepares you well, and time seems to fly in his class. He's a great lecturer and really respects his students!

Brandon is hands down my favorite professor that I have ever had! You can tell he genuinely cares about his students and how they do in his class. He is hilarious and makes class actually enjoyable (making the T-F mandatory class bearable). I learned a lot in his class and would definitely take other classes with him!

I love Brandon! Best professor I've ever had. He's funny, caring, and really good at teaching. He comes up with the weirdest ways to get us to remember things, but it works. Makes the class fun and it goes by quickly. Participation is required which I usually hate, but he makes it a comfortable environment so you feel like you're hanging w/ friends

Brandon is an awesome professor. He cares about what he does. As long as you show up to class, participate, and do your work then it should be an easy A. Also extra credit will be presented here and there in small ways but nothing big.

Brandon is super funny and makes the class go by fast, while still getting all the material in.  Make sure you pay attention and participate in class, but other than that, enjoy the semester!! Would take his class ten times over.
Only have had this teacher for a few weeks, he is amazing! If you have him you're lucky!!

Brandon is intelligent, passionate about the course content, easy to understand, and very good at relating Spanish to English. He is also comedicensuring a fun classand easily approachable. He is willing to help anyone outside of class, and he almost always replies to e-mails shortly after they are sent. I highly recommend this professor.
Brandon was a great professor. He's very approachable if you have questions or need clarification on anything. He's funny and tries to keep the class entertaining.
Great professor, very fair. Also very funny and easy to talk to.

Brandon was a wonderful instructor for Spanish 1155. He is very responsive to students in terms of picking up on what they're understanding well and what they're having trouble with. He is laid back, approachable, and his quizzes and tests are very fair. He also understands that every student isn't wildly enthused to be taking Spanish.

I took intensive spanish as a night class and Brandon Cannon was my favorite professor by far. He is hilarious and keeps you interested, even if the subject makes you want to rip your face off. Participation is a large part of your grade. I would highly recommend him to anyone taking spanish. Don't buy a paper copy of the textbook.

She's very nice, but she teaches the class like a high school Spanish class. Everyone had to learn the names of all other students in the class and she forced you to work with different people every class. It's very hands on and you must participate every class period. You have five free absences before they take down your grade.

I thought Professor Steensen was a great professor! The class was a lot of work but I think that's more the requirements of the fault of the Spanish department and not her. She was fun to talk with in class and really good at teaching the material! She also has a one grace period policy where you can miss one class without an excused absence.

I couldn't finish a week in her class. I'm a typical tough it out student but this class was harder than chemistry. I felt very uncomfortable because on the first day we were expected to speak full conversations in Spanish. She assigned 9 homework assignments the first week of school. Her Canvas page was very confusing and difficult to follow.

Worst class I have ever taken in my life. She is degrading, rude and passive aggressive if you are confused. I had such a passion to learn Spanish and was even considering pursuing a minor before her course but after her class I am completely burnt out, she took the joy out of learning. I will never get over how terrible this professor was.

Overall I think she's an ok professor,was very helpful in certain situations but MAN was she difficult. It's like no matter what you say or try to offer other solutions to a problem you have, she just doesn't care. Grading is very tough and isn't understanding for something out of your control (link doesn't work, something isn't loading, etc.)

She was rude to the students and belittled them for not getting what she was asking right away. She has improved tech wise and is good with organization. Attendance matters a lot and you are required to participate multiple times a session. A lot of homework and she expects you to retain all of the information. Do not take her class.

She gets easily annoyed/frustrated if you don't participate and is very strict. If you are absent from class more than once without clear proof, then it takes 3% off your final grade. She will randomly call on people and gives a lot of weekly work. She isn't understanding or lenient with grades. The final wasn't awful, but I had to study a ton.

Prof Steensen assigns a lot of HW, due to the fact the course is monitored by the Span department. I found her classes to be extremely helpful and she kept the class interesting and had a good sense of humor (which I don't think a lot of other students understood). She's accessible outside of class and will help you with assignments whenever needed

Took Spanish all throughout middle school and high school and planned on minoring in it at OSU. This professor completely ruined my passion for Spanish. Only take this class if you wanna know how it feels to be treated like a number instead of a student and are down to completely ruin your mental state.

Impossible class. Quizzes and exams are weighted very heavily, and she is an extremely tough grader. The average on tests would be in the B- to C+ range for every test, with it getting as low as 60 for one test, and there is no curve (this is just her aswell people with other Spanish professors bad easier exams). Do not take.

Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. THE worst teacher I've had, not even just professor. The only good thing about this class is she's quite organized but other than that she's awful and does NOT care about her students at all. She's rude and not helpful. Be warned, do not take this class.

Most problems i had with this class just seemed to be the standard for all OSU Spanish classes, not just this class/professor. There is a lot of homework and you're expected to really participate in class. You pretty much learn outside of class and practice in class but she did seem to care about the students success, and the tests werent bad.

literally the worst class ive ever taken. i have severe anxiety and she did random participation every single day multiple times a day. and beware, she doesnt teach. she expects you to learn all material outside of class and know everything when you come in. super passive aggressive and so much homework.

For the most part, this was a simple class, and I did see my Spanish improve! HOWEVER, it was to no help from Professor Steensen. This woman is the rudest professor I have ever encountered, who also assigned way too much homework, work over breaks, and is an extremely tough grader. She always has a rude response when you're asking for genuine help.

Absolutely horrible experience in her class. I probably would have failed if it wasnt for my prior knowledge from high school. Gives a ridiculous amount of work and is a tough grader. Very hard tests and fails to prepare students for the exams. It was common the highest score on exams would be in the B- to C+ range, and there would be no curve.
Never had a professor get so angry over things out of the students control.

She gave my class 75 Pearson MyLab assignments the first week of school. That is not even it. We had 11 "quizzes" in CarmenCourse on top of that. I am not even joking or exaggerating. She asks the class questions, expecting us to know stuff she didn't teach and gets passive aggressive when you don't understand her constant unclear instructions.

Harsh on attendance and speaking grades. Rude and unaccepting of technical difficulties through covid. Docked 2-3 % because 1 min late a few times. Homework Heavy. Recieved 95% on everything but got B+ because my camera didn't work. Will not round up. Assignments in 3 different places and not put on the calendar. Not tech savy. Not organized well.

THE WORST PROFESSOR EVER. This lady is terrible and super rude. She is not helpful at all and always has a smart remark when you genuinely are asking questions to better understand the class. I have a real passion for learning this language and she made my learning experience horrible. I would not recommend her as a professor to anyone.

Her class was super easy for me because I have taken Spanish throughout middle school and high school. For that reason, I found it to be especially boring. Her lectures were, well, non-existent and she doesn't give much feedback. Also, because it was all online and she is not very tech-savvy, everything was extremely confusing and hard to navigate.

Class is super easy for me since I am a fluent spanish speaker, but that doesnt change the fact that you're quiz grades dont get counted if you do not show up to class. The class comes easy to me but I see how rude she is towards others that have very little spanish background.

Took her in the midst of COVID for what it's worth, but she's not very understanding or willing to work with you, she really lays on the assignments thick and doesn't post lectures or anything unless the whole class is doing badly, so you teach yourself. She'll answer questions during class but kinda rudely, and the assignments are time-consuming

I literally would give her 0 stars if I could. She is so rude ALL THE TIME and is constantly correcting people on the smallest things before you even finish your damn sentence. She doesnt even teach anything either. And she is a HUGE stickler in due dates like god forbid you turn in something twenty seconds late. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.
I thought she was honestly kind of rude to a lot of the students in class. I also think that she definitely made the class harder than it was supposed to be.

A lot of her lectures are just going over activities from the textbook. It is mainly group-work with your fellow classmates. She can be rude some days and she makes sure every single person participates in the class everyday. However you do get 5 free absences which is nice. You have homework due every week but its not too bad.

Worst professor Ive ever had. Her classes are unorganized and she is awkward and doesnt know how to teach. Would never take this class again, it was literal hell. So much to do after every class and most of it wasnt relevant to what we were learning. Shes very rude also.
Not a very good professor, she's rude and tries to be funny but isn't. Class was awkward and pretty boring. Take another professor if you want an A or B. Had to really work for a C.

Worst Spanish teacher I've ever had. Evelyn is very rude to students and gets mad when you don't know the answers to questions. The professor told one girl in my class who was literally 2 minutes late (we hadn't even started lecture yet) to take the bus next time to make it to her class on time in front of everyone, she also called the class dumb.

I was sick one day and turned my final project into her box and had it time stamped. Also I had to record myself reading this so on the oral section I got an 18/100 because  there was no paper yet she just didnt want to walk to the next room and get it out of her mailbox !!! Please guys DO NOT TAKE HER CLASSES
I would recommend her to most people. You are expected to study and come prepared to class, but I feel like she does a good job at teaching, and you can tell she cares about her students success.

Worst Spanish professor I've ever had.  Not a native speaker and cannot teach the nuances of the language very well.  Would give pop quizzes a lot on material we had not learned.  Would not recommend.

Worst Spanish teacher I've ever had. She's not a native speaker, which I believe makes a huge difference. She's pretty rude about answering questions and clarifying things in general. She doesn't notify you when upcoming assignments are due, and for a low-level Spanish class, she has high expectations. Didn't enjoy her at all.

AU15 was her first time teaching this course at the Cbus campus and she did fairly well. When people ask obvious questions or struggle to grasp easy concepts, she tends to mock them, but she means well. If you need additional help, you should stay after class, rather than asking questions during class. Attendance is huge in 1155.

Professor Diaz-Basteris created a safe space for all students which made me feel comfortable presenting as my full self in the classroom. I loved that she took us on trips beyond the classroom and that her assignments were tailored to help students develop skills beyond the classroom. Highly recommend her courses!

The professor made a point to connect the course material to contemporary events. In doing so, she made complex ideas accessible and demonstrated the use value of theoretical frameworks in day-to-day life.

I'm definitely taking other classes offered by this professor.

Dra. Díaz-Basteris is one of my favorite professors thus far at OSU. She brings a unique perspective to the Spanish curriculum which is so valuable for a field that often forgets about the Caribbean and LatinX communities. Her lectures are engaging, and it's not hard to do well on assignments as long as you're engaged in class and put in effort.

Professor Mason is one of the funniest & caring professors ever. Her classes & assignments are very clearly laid out and you know exactly what is expected. A lot of the homework is graded on completion. There are several graded writing assignments that make up a decent portion of your grade, but if you put in the work, you can receive a good grade.

Mason is passionate and funny, making her classes pretty enjoyable. However there is a lot of homework, with more than one assignment due almost each class day. She is quite accommodating and kind, and I'd recommend her as long as you can handle a higher workload.

Spanish 3403H - I thought she had good assignments and entertaining class discussions. The course material was well-balanced between reading, writing, and grammar. It is not too difficult if you keep up with readings and homework.

SPAN: 3403

Amazing professor, very energetic and cares about her students and teaching. Wonderful person and very reasonable. Clear grading criteria and clearer syllabus. Great communicator and admits faults and mistakes Loved her.

COURSE: SPAN2320, NOT SPAN 1103

if she is an option for any of your classes, do it. she is knowledgeable and endlessly energetic, truly loves teaching and is talented at it, maybe needs less caffeine but eh. wish I could do the semester over again, she made reading a 1000 page book entertaining and exciting

Loved her! I had not so good professors for Spanish 1 and 2 so having her for Spanish 3 was a great change! She was able to make the material easy to understand and would work with you until you understood it. She was a really nice grader. She was also super accommodating when I had to miss class a few times and when I had to reschedule my final.

no complaints! Becca is reasonable, knowledgable, speaks Spanish and English fluently, and is approachable/willing to help. In class she pretty much exclusively speaks Spanish but it's not as confusing or stressful as I thought it would be. She does a good job preparing you for the tests and most classes went by pretty fast.

Becca is pretty laid back and always makes class interesting. She understands that everyone has different strengths and encourages you to step out side your comfort zone but doesn't force it. She has lots of funny stories and is pretty approachable. She does a decent job of trying to explain things in different ways so everyone can understand

Becca was so awesome! There are a lot of tests and a decent amount of homework, but she really helps you understand the material and prepares you for the exams. She's pretty laid back, a bit quiet but when she does get off topic, she always says something hilarious. Her class is a very fun atmosphere and I would definitely take it again if I could.
Took her for 1155 and she was so funny and awesome! Great at explaining everything and made Spanish easier
Professor Varveris was very personable and fun, 100% reccommend

Class was fun and interactive, we did all sorts of games like Gimkit and Kahoot and Quizziz. We were prepared very well for exams. Getting an A was simply a matter of showing up and participating, with some vocabulary practice on your own. Janelle cared about us and got to know us. Would definitely recommend her.

Janelle is the best. She makes class so much fun and I always looked forward to seeing her. She prepared us so well for every quiz and exam. She makes learning Spanish fun by incorporating games and conversation. If you have the chance to take her class, I definitely recommend it!

Coming from someone who dreaded taking Spanish for my major, she is the best professor I could have asked for. Genuinely such a fun and kind teacher. She truly cares for her students and wants to have a connection with them. She reminded me of all my favorite high school teachers, incorporating many games into her lessons. She wants you to succeed.

Really good professor and we often had fun in the class while learning. Lots of partnered discussions and we even played games that related to our definitions and dances. She was hilarious and joked a lot with us. Very hard to upset and very willing to help: before class, after, office hours, etc. She was very understanding about Spanish abilities

Best professor I have had at OSU! Beyond caring and will go over lots of hard concepts and information until you understand. Lots of review games that help a lot and offer extra credit on a couple of assignments too. Wish I could have her again, would recommend her!!!

Easily one of the best Spanish teachers I have ever had! My fire alarm went off right before my oral exam, and she let me reschedule without any hassle. SPAN 155 is a lot of material covered in one semester, but she explains it in such a fun and concise manner. She doesn't expect you to be perfect or know everything!

My favorite Spanish teacher ever! She is very personable and caring and strives to make all materials easily understandable and enjoyable to learn. We often did games during class to study and it was very helpful.

I loved her so much! She was by far the best Spanish teacher I've ever had. She thoroughly prepared us for exams and always gave us plenty of study material. There was sometimes a lot of homework through Pearson but that was required by the university, not her (you do have to complete it but she doesn't typically give out any extra homework). 12/10
She is an awesome professor who is always making sure her students are understanding concepts! Just in general a very nice, understanding professor and would totally take her class again!

I really enjoyed taking this course with Professor Harker. Homework every night, which you do get used to. Attendance is mandatory, but you're allowed 4 grace periods (which I didn't even end up using all). Overall, Professor Harker was a very understanding and patient professor!

Had her for 1102, flipped classroom approach - so get ready to speak/listen to other students. I'd imagine all the sections for this course are flipped classroom. Harker is enthusiastic, and really wants you to do well. The class has a lot of easy busy work (unavoidable), and attendance is graded. Bare studying can get you an A.
There was lots of homework in this class (although probably the same for all professors). She was nice and wanted students to succeed.

Normally I am not one to complain, but this class has been my least favorite that I have taken at OSU. The class is not necessarily hard, but attendance is mandatory and there is homework every night. Also, the professor is not forgiving AT ALL and grades difficult for a class that is not of great rigor. Seriously, take this class with anyone else.

I did not like Professor Parker at all. She is nit-picky with the way she grades and is often unfair to students in her classes. If she were a student she would definitely be the teacher's pet. If you have her, I would switch. I wish I did.
Not a great class

I really enjoyed this spanish class and would recommend taking it in person if you can as the environment is easier to participate in and I felt I learned a lot more that way. She always tried to keep the class interesting and fun, asking us questions about ourselves and telling us about her experiences abroad as well.

Profe Sosa truly made Spanish a manageable class despite my lack of foundation in the language. He is a caring, kind professor who is willing to put in the work to make sure his students succeed. A one of a kind, great professor! I highly recommend him if you can fit him in your schedule.

Professor Sosa is a great professor who is genuinely caring and is willing to be flexible to work with you as long as you communicate. As far as the class goes the department decides the majority of the content, however, he does his best to personalize it to work for his class and ensure your success. I can't recommend him enough!

Sosa is actually amazing. He is always asking for feedback and definitely has a passion for helping you learn. Only a lot of homework because 1155 is a fast paced course and the university requires him to assign certain assignments. If you participate and talk with him class will be great! His wife even made us cookies!!!!

Best professor I've ever had. Couldn't recommend more. From the first day of class you can tell this is a man who loves to teach and loves his students. Probably the happiest and caring person I've ever met. Goes above and beyond! Literally brought us cookies he made himself. I was horrible at spanish and some how still did well in the class.

Ricardo is an excellent instructor for Spanish 1101. He was so helpful and never made you feel stupid for not knowing something. He really tried to work with you to have you be as successful as possible. Just keep on top of memorizing grammar and vocab. Also, you grade is boosted exponentially at the end of the semester because of your MyLab hw's.

Profesor Sosa is honestly the best Professor I've had in college. He takes so much time out of his way to help his students and is very helpful in and out of class. Spanish 1155 is a difficult class, but Sosa made this one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. 12/10, highly recommend taking Spanish with this Professor!
the best professor ive had so far ive never met a man who cares more about his students well being. overall great guy and made the class 10x more enjoyable compared to my classmates w other profs

Wow. I can not describe how amazing Ricardo is. I had him last semester and he still goes out of his way to say hello to me and check up on me. He is the most caring professor I have ever had. His class is a ton of fun and he does not make learning and grades seem overwhelming. If you can, please switch into his class. I love Ricardo!
he is very nice, and engaging. He made learning spanish fun

Professor Sosa is one of the kindest, most genuine professors I have ever had. He teaches in a way that is engaging and empathetic. He is very understanding and willing to help you both in class and at office hours/outside of class. He is passionate about what he does and it shows every day in class!

Sosa is genuinely one of the best professors for spanish at Ohio State. He is extremely caring, encouraging, and helpful. He made our class genuinely fun, and was very good at explaining new topics, grammar, and vocab. He always made time for us outside of class and office hours if we had additional questions. If you can get Sosa you won't regret!
I love Ricardo! He is the kindest man in the world and cares deeply for every one of his students. He is always laughing and cracking jokes. I could not recommend a Spanish teacher better than him.

AMAZING SPANISH TEACHER! She cared about teaching the language well and helping you succeed. There is effort to put in on your end, but if you are eager to learn about Spanish you'll do fine. She also had a lot of personal experience with the language and was very open to answer questions about culture/language variability. I loved her class.

Heather was a great teacher, she actually cared about the class and that everyone understood the material. She was a kinda slow grader (things came up in the semester, I get that, but not having grades for a quiz posted by the time the next quiz rolled around was unencouraging). Grades BY RUBRIC, almost no wiggle room.

Other than that, loved her.
I did not appreciate any part of the way she instructed class. I found it condescending/passive aggressive

Tania is very friendly and if you put forth the effort, she is very understanding when it comes to any accommodations. She's very thorough and allows for lots of practice of conjugations and vocab in class, and is very nice if you make a mistake to actually help you understand. Lots of homework, but I believe that's the department responsible.

She is one of the best as far as Spanish courses are concerned. Very nice, friendly, and caring professor. However, the nature of the class includes a lot of busywork, exams, and discussions, all of which are weighed separately, so you must do well on each section, or you will have a difficult time bringing your grade up. Nevertheless, she did the

Tania is super understanding and makes class so much fun. There is a lot of reading and homework for each reading, but it is manageable. And she offers a ton of extra credit opportunities (basically one each week) so make an effort and you'll pass no problem.
Tania is a great professor! She really cares about your learning and wants to help in any way she can.
Great teacher, originally from Brazil. She clearly loves the material. Very willing to work with students outside of class.

> Graduate Teaching Associate (as of SP24) who is energetic, obviously knowledgeable about the course concepts, and really does want to help students.
> Simplified complex grammatical concepts well. 
> Provided good feedback (critical in a course like Advanced Grammar).
> HW not difficult; there is a final research paper in Spanish, so be prepared.
Very fun
I absolutely loved having Montse as my teacher! She was extremely helpful in class, using a lot of gestures in order to be understood (since most of the class was taught in Spanish).

great professor, really sweet. spanish is a hard subject for most but with her as the professor it was really not that bad. 3 exams, 2 talkabroads, 1 writing assignment. seems like a lot but she really prepares you for it and is a light grader. very kind and care about students
I had her for the launch seminar that was required. She is super nice and really understanding. I would gladly take her spanish classes and shes super cool.

Dr. Aubry is very kind and easy to work with. The class has a lot of class activities and group activities, but she makes them fun. Attendance is mandatory, but she is better at working with you than the rest of the Spanish department. I am planning on taking another one of her classes for fun, because she is that great. 10/10 for Dr. Aubry!

I didn't have her for any Spanish classes, I had her online for a launch seminar. She's incredibly kind and engaging, you can tell she really cares about her students. I hope I can get her for Spanish 1103 when I get there because she is an incredible professor.
The sweetest professor I have ever had. Always very accommodating and did everything she could to make her students feel comfortable.
Languages are best learned through practice, and this course had a great amount of it. Professor was very chill, and the lectures and activities were very informative.

Professor Aubry was such a kind and genuine professor. She truly cared about her students' well-being. She encouraged real learning which is what I appreciate most about her.  She told us it was okay to not know every single word in a reading or video. She encouraged us to speak Spanish, even if we fumbled over our words or made mistakes.

Stephanie was one of my favorite teachers at OSU. She makes classes fun and creates a space where I felt totally comfortable talking and sharing ideas. She also cares so much for her students and if you reach out to her about anything she helps find a solution or is very accommodating.

You can tell Stephanie truly cares about each student and wants them to succeed. Show up to class, participate, and do your very limited homework and you will do well in the class. She prepares you for the exams in class and through homework, and her class is actually enjoyable. She is understanding and is easy to reach outside of class. Take her!
Sra. Aubry was available anytime I needed her. She offered extra activities to help me understand concepts I was having difficulty grasping. She was an incredible instructor.

This class was super easy and I recommend her for anyone taking Spanish 2202. She will often give you grades for homework without even checking it. I got through the class without using the book however I would recommend getting it. She is very flexible and will extend any deadline for a valid reason.
Dr. Aubry is personable and its obvious she loves her job! She clearly just wants her students to succeed and does what she can to help them along! Her class is also well structured and fun.
Stephanie is great. She made assignments painless and created an environment very conducive to learning. She is also very willing to accept late work and doesn't mind if you miss a few classes.

Since it was an online class, she didn't teach much obviously. It was mainly mySpanishlab work and talkabroads. Some livechats that were group work which was annoying since its an online class. But otherwise, she graded very generously, and slowly. Would take again though

Stephanie is one of the sweetest people I've ever met. Very understanding, accepts late work. She presents the material clearly and is very helpful if you have questions or don't get it at first. I learned so much in her class, but only had to study a little to do well on the tests. Downsides: expensive textbook, pay for talkabroad, slowish grader

Stephanie Aubry is an extremely sweet lady who really cares about her students.  She gives great feedback and is very easy to reach outside of class if you ever have any questions. The course is an easy A as long as you do the homework and review the material we cover in class before the exams. She often does fun activities to practice.

She was an absolutely amazing professor and I recommend her to everybody! She is super nice and understands if anything comes up that stops you from going to class. Her class is super easy but attendance is mandatory (4 unexcused absences are allowed before points are deducted)
Excellent! Very easy to understand, very helpful and very nice. She is a wonderful professor!

Senora Aubry was such a delight to have during my first semester at OSU. She was always there to help and always understood if you couldn't get an assignment done or if you simply forgot to do one. If you have to take any spanish I would HIGHLY recommend her out of all the other professors. Our class was fairly easy and she would always students.
Only spoke Spanish in lectures and I don't know Spanish... that's why im in Spanish 1.

I also took her 1102 class and she's a great professor. She does require attendance, but her lectures can be engaging sometimes which makes the time go by fast. Always ask questions because she's very understanding!

I don't think that this professor fully realizes that this is a Spanish 1 class. The assignments that allow multiple attempts are fairly easy and allow you to learn from them, but assignments such as the midterm are incredibly difficult and much harder than what is discussed in lecture and the textbook. Not very forgiving or conducive to learning.

HW varied in "difficulty", but not assigned every week. 2 analyses and 2 shorter "papers". Attendance not required, but interesting class. Nice man, very interested and passionate about what he teaches. Accessible, but feedback on bigger assignment is vague. No final
He was such a nice professor who responded VERY quickly to emails. He also graded very very easily. He cares a lot about spanish and is an entertaining teacher. Would recommend!

Professor Burgoyne was so positive and really made me start to enjoy Spanish again. He gave us two assignments every week: a reflection about what we read and a discussion post (each about 200 words). There were two essays that we had plenty of time to write and our final was 4 mini analyses of stuff we had read. Definitely recommend him!

Bought a used textbook off amazon (recommend), but you can access it online through OSU library (only one copy). Initially challenging for a non-native speaker, but prof is very accessible and provides good feedback. There are several oral/partial exams, as well as a final. Not a hard grader. Weekly assignments aren't super hard, but do take time.

Professor Munoz is a great guy and willing to help if you care enough to reach out.
My grade in the class was bad, but it was my own fault. I recommend that you do not miss any assignments because late work is not accepted. Professor Munoz is more than fair when it comes to grading and a lot of assignments are participation based, so dont miss any!

Professor Ruz is a great professor. He is helpful and corrective when you mess up. He gives you feedback to help you be better at Spanish like pronunciation & grammar. He has great humor and you can tell he actually cares about students. The format of the class is basically the same as 1101 & 02. I would recommend trying to get him as a professor!

He does give a pretty consistent medium heavy course load every week. I personally didn't enjoy the way he taught, he made me feel stupid when I got things wrong. On the other hand, he gets back to you really fast by inbox on canvas + he offers extra support/practice if you need it. Would prefer another professor if I continued with Spanish.

He was great! I had a bad professor for 1102, so I was pessimistic coming in and just wanted to get my GE done. But he's super funny, gives you SO much practice in class that helps you massively if you just participate, and is very non-judgemental and kind if you mess up. Literally just participate and it's an easy A, despite it being a hard gen ed
I don't like Spanish at all, but he was a pretty good professor. He was nice, funny, and gave less homework than my only prior Spanish course.

1155 is harder because its spanish 1 and 2 jammed into one semester so the pace is really fast, professor Ruz did a great job teaching with the time he had and helped people learn Spanish in different ways,

One of the best professors I have taken at OSU! Super easy to talk with, makes class interesting, and very kind when helping you correct yourself. Spanish here is just poor, the class is basically based on midterm and final which are pretty difficult, and other random assignments that don't really add anything. Definitely take a class with him!!

Very fun professor! I learned a lot from Dr. Munoz Ruz, he is a great person and I would highly reccomend taking his class! The only downside is around 3 hours of online supersite homework when he assigns it but it is genuinely helpful practice

My favorite Spanish professor I've had at OSU so far. The class isn't exactly a thrilling one by any means but he made it as interesting as he could. He was very helpful with working on assignments and doing rewrites for the papers. You could tell that he really cares about his students and loves his job.

The class was a lot of busy work. It was 8wks over the summer so fast pace a little bit. He is very nice. The assignments were all easy and if you completed it you got full credit. The tests were somewhat hard but he gives practice quizzes to prep for the exams. Overall he is nice and just make sure to stay on top of due dates for assignments.
Very kind professor. The courseload isn't light by any means, but she makes sure that if you're putting in the effort, you'll thrive. I recommend her.

Manuela is easily the best professor I have had thus far. If you are lucky enough to have her as your professor then you will have a great experience in Spanish 1102. Put in the work, come to class prepared, and you will thrive. Big emphasis on speaking in Spanish in class and discussing with partners:)

Profe was absolutely incredible. I would not have passed this class if I did not have her. She is a fair grader and wants everyone to understand the concept. Not the greatest at learning languages and I would not take another Spanish class unless she was teaching it!

Profe Olaru was the best professor I have ever had. You can tell she puts a lot of work into the class. I really love Spanish so Im really glad that I took her class. I feel like I got to practice my Spanish all the time and she made the class really interesting and was always very quick at grading and responding to emails.

Prof. Olaru was super sweet and was very focused on class participation. we covered a lot of material and everything was pretty easy. you can still do well if you do mediocre on the midterms and exams. Talkabroads and an online component, but they were pretty easy, just time-consuming and stressful. understanding if you missed some of the deadlines
She doesnt answer emails and she expects you to learn everything on your own. Dont recommend at all.

She loves Spanish and the culture and makes me excited to learn about it! She cares a lot about her students and wants to help you any way she can. The class is pretty standard with a regular amount of tests and homework, but participation is super important.

She is a great professor! SO helpful, and provides specific study guides and rubrics for tests, papers and exams. She is very easy to talk to, and participation is a big grade in her class. Do your homework and MyLab online, and you´ll be fine. She will work with you if you have to miss class or something. One of the best professors that I´ve had!

Manuela is a fantastic professor! It is easy to see that she genuinely cares about the education of her students. She goes above and beyond when answering questions and providing feedback. The course material is not difficult, and the class overall is structured, but not too strict.

Manuela is pretty much everything you'd want out of a teacher, though I did feel like a lot of the stuff I had to teach myself. The class is set up in a way that pretty much forces you to learn. I found it to be pretty easy and enjoyable. Not a hard grader at all and is very approachable. Expect homework nearly every night and go to class for an A.
She is very helpful and will not be a tough grader. 10/10 recommend.

Manuela was an awesome professor! I had taken a few Spanish classes before this one, so I didn't find the material to be difficult. Even for those that are relatively new to the language, this class should not very challenging as Manuela provides nightly homework and in class activities that thoroughly cover the material.

Manuela wasn't the greatest. She makes you learn Spanish yourself, as she's not very helpful. Most of the time, she'd just give us homework on something we haven't learned and expect us to teach ourselves, and then only do like half of her presentation. That's fine, but for a foreign language, it's not really fair. Other than that, she's OK.

Manuela is awesome! I have never taken spanish before this year and she's so helpful. Her tests really aren't bad. Just show up to class and participate and you don't really need to study. Makes the material fun and class was a good time! Tell her to bring flan on fridays.

Coming into this class, I had a solid background in Spanish. So much of this material I had already seen. For someone who is learning this all for the first time, it can get a little tricky. However, much of the class time was spent doing activities which really helped. Homework was usually given nightly, but it was never a crazy amount and helped.

Was kind and considerate during these times, however, I didn't like how his lectures were long and had a lot of information in them. There was also homework that wasn't difficult just time-consuming (not great if you're already super busy). Final group project at the end. Instructions for assignments were unclear.

Santy is a nice person but a terrible teacher. He is not organized and can be very confusing when teaching. His lectures are not well prepared (what he says doesn't match with the book content!) and he doesn't know basic Spanish grammar rules. It is obviuos that he wasn't well trained by the department. Again, nice guy but not enough :/
He is a great prof! I have loved having him for 3404. Class is pretty easy, so if you study the book and attend class, you'll be fine. Super accessible and caring.

Not a difficult class if you have a strong background in Spanish. Santy is a really nice person and knowledgeable about linguistics, but was very obviously not prepared by the department to teach this course. Lectures were often more confusing than anything else, and the class seemed to lack any sort of structure.

Santiago was very nice and did everything he could to make sure his students understood the material. At times he was a bit confusing, but he takes time to explain further if there is anything you don't understand. If you go to class, participate, and read the book, you'll do great in his class!

Santiago was very nice and definitely tried his best to help all of the students succeed. However, had I not taken Spanish in high school, I think Santiago would have been really confusing. He knows Spanish but is not the best at teaching it. Be prepared to learn from the book.
Her classes and content are very structured and easy to follow. If you do things in time, its a really easy class

As someone who struggles in Spanish, Professor Sundt made the material easy to understand and helped me develop my Spanish reading, listening, and speaking skills. If you can take Spanish 201 with Professor Sundt take it. She is one of the best Spanish teachers at Rhodes.
Catherine is so nice! She has a great sense of humor and makes class interesting. Be sure to contribute to discussions, it's the best way to learn in this class.

She was a good teacher. She has some tricky questions on her quizzes, and she could work to help student's listening skills more, but she does help you understand the class material. She makes a few mistakes here and there, but overall this class is easy if you put in the effort.

She is extremely nice and helpful. She really likes what she does and tries to make it as fun as possible. Attendance is mandatory but even with getting points off my average for missing class, I still got an A. Just read the assignments and you should do well.
I really like Catherine.  She was nice, funny, and very helpful whenever I had questions.  I didn't like the class all that much but it wasn't her fault.
She was awesome! I just had her for 103.66 and i wish i could take her class for 104. So understaing in the oral tests and she makes the class fun and explains the material well... I reccomend her!!

She was a fantastic teacher. I wish I had her for all of my other spanish classes. She is a great teacher. She broke down everything for you to understand. She was very fair in grading. She inderstands that not everyone is comfortable speaking spanish so she help you overcome it
Great Job!

Great teacher. She is by FAR my favorite spanish teacher at Ohio State. She speaks at a level that is not too complex and makes sure the students know a topic thoroughly before moving on. She's funny and class was enjoyable to go to! I definately recommend her to anyone!!
Catherine was great. She's really nice, laid back, and understading. She isn't intimidating at all, and she's always there if you need help.
No Comments

As of 06-07, she's a 1st-year grad student.  She knows most of what she's talking about, but I've learned from better, most of which comes from her age and lack of experience.  Extremely easy-going and lenient.

She takes forever to grade and give feedback. There is a ton of homework each week. You basically are teaching yourself, but you still have to go to class at your scheduled times because you are graded on it. The test and quizzes are so hard and don't match the study guides that she gives you. She grades on spelling, and accent marks too! Study!

I think 90% of the issues in this class stem from bad department structure. It is obvious she doesn't know much about Latin America, but she's perfect for people interested in Iberian Spanish. She's extremely knowledgable on grammar. Frequently though, this class felt like that "my comido favorito es pizza" SNL bit.

She's a good person and cares about her students passing. She is always up for a zoom meeting even thought students don't really like to ask for help. In this class u rlly just gotta study and put the time in. Listen in class all the time cuz u don't wanna miss anything and u will be fine.

This class is not that difficult if you put a little bit of work in. Anna is very caring and came in every day ready to help out her students. Going to class 4 days a week sucks but so is the case for those Spanish classes. It is a grind but in the end, you do learn a ton.

This might be the worst class I've taken at OSU. Hates when students ask questions and has a lot of attitude. Only met with us for one hour a week in a four credit hours class (scheduled one hour tue-fri). Not at all empathetic or understanding of extenuating circumstances. Be prepared for no response with emails (have waited 3+ weeks). DO NOT TAKE

There is so much work in this class! It takes up a lot of your free time, and I ended up spending at least 10 hours every week working on the course material. The exams aren't bad, but they are heavily weighted. Professor Hamilton also had an attitude and gets annoyed if you have questions.

Doesn't enjoy teaching, acts as though it is inconvenient to teach us, rushing through class and material then gets mad when we do poorly on tests and assignments. Tons of unnecessary work and protects (busy work). Be prepared for group work! Worst professor and class I've taken in my four years of college!

Professor Hamilton is definitely the best spanish teacher I've ever had. Her lectures were clear and she's willing to go over something as many times as needed until students understood material well. She answers emails/messages quickly & thoroughly. All the notes you need are within the provided slides. She cares for her students and their success

Seemed very disinterested in teaching and acted as if she was being inconvenienced when people asked questions or did not understand something. Had a very strict attendance policy and lowered my grade 16% at the end of the semester for missing 4 classes, even though two were for documented deaths in my family, which she accused me of lying about.
Sra. Hamilton is super nice and teaches the content really well. There is a fair amount of homework each week. She also gives lots of review material before exams and overall was a superb teacher!

She never truly explains ideas during class and most of your learning is based on the text book. She assigns lots of homework, and overall does not seem like she truly enjoys teaching. She can be rude towards students and shoot them down when they would ask a question. Sometimes would make you feel dumb for not knowing an answer or word.

She Is typical for a university Spanish professor. Nothing stands out. She has nice lectures but the amount of homework can be out of proportion but that's more of a department issue. She is open to helping you understand and understands when it gets boring or confusing. She helps you prepare for exams really well.

You definitely cant skip this class, but the lectures are really interesting anyway. Shes super funny and really cares about if the students are understanding the material. Very passionate about the language!

Prof. Hamilton is nice, however her lectures aren't very helpful, some of her explanations aren't clear and she doesn't give you the powerpoint she uses. Other Spanish professors allow you to turn in MyLab work until last day of semester, she closes it down along the way. Easier for her to grade but harder on the students. LOTS of homework!

I genuinely loved having Anna! I had her class at 8:00 am, so it was harder to pay attention because of that. However, she heavily encourages working together. She is honestly so kind and willing to help. I had some medical things that I got sent home for, and she set up zoom each day for me in class. I really appreciate her as a prof & person!
HW takes like 1-2 hours every week with added projects every now and then. Easy if you stay on top of things.

Profesora Hamilton's class was very easy. The course material was very interesting and there were lots of assignments to help improve your grade. I personally would not take her again since her lectures were very boring and she did not seem very interested in teaching.
