She was okay.. I didnt feel as if I learned much, however. Homework daily, lots of quizzes & 2 part midterm & final. Mylabs due every Sunday. She was personable and a great person, average professor

Sra. Hamilton was super nice & taught the material very well. She was my prof for Spanish 1103 in SP20 when COVID-19 sent us home mid-semester & she was the best professor of them all to adjust to online. Definitely recommend!

Love this professor! Her online class was very clear, easy to understand and self explanatory. Honestly, you can complete all the homework for the week in a day if you wanted to. She is actually very fun to talk to and has a good personality. At first it seems like she might be unapproachable to talk to but she always responds to emails. Easy class

Honestly I was very good at Spanish my whole high school and college career up until this point. I would totally understand the content that we learned each week but still managed to fail every exam / quiz. This was a general consensus as shown by grade averages.

anna was great, i just wasn't a huge fan of spanish. there are situations where you will have to webcam chat with other students which was stressful at first but just do them for the points. i failed all tests and exams and still passed the class
She's not a bad professor, just adhering strictly to the Spanish departments rules. You must truly participate every day to get full points and make sure you do your homework. It's easy but annoying
Great professor that makes it easy to get an A and she's pretty funny to.

I took Anna in the fall for Spanish 1102 and she was awesome. There is a fair amount of homework via the textbook, worksheets, or online, but she is exceptionally clear at what she expects and gives tons of practice. She is always willing to help and she gives you study guides telling you exactly what will be on the test.
Friendly, jokes around a lot

Anna was a very passionate, professional and personable professor. She loves to teach her students and to inspire them about the Spanish language. Throughout the semester, there are two quizzes, two exams, one final, and one oral exam. Anna was always there for any student(s) who needed extra help. I would definitely recommend taking her class !

Hated this class with a passion. I had to drop it because there was no way possible to pass. Told her I was not understanding the material and needed extra help and she told me that she was a teacher not a translator. I generally enjoy Spanish but she made me hate going to class every morning.

I loved Anna she was a fun teacher with a good sense of humor. She was also more laid back and would let us out of class early some days. She is the so far the best Spanish teacher that I've had. She is also not very critical when it comes to grading if you make a small mistake you won't lose a point.

This professor was very unhelpful and overall passive-aggressive towards us. She talked briefly, gave us questions, and then made us do partner or group work for the whole class. I do not recommend taking Spanish 1103 with her if possible. Still relatively easy, but could not stand her.

The class I took was not very difficult; it was pretty enjoyable. She talks in Spanish so it helps train audio comprehension. Participation is graded and attendance is important for your tests, as we go over topics that will be on them.

Prof. Angulo was a very sweet lady. Participation is a must in this class, which makes sense since it is a language class. She truly cares about students and is willing to work through issues with you in a timely manner. There is simple daily homework and weekly homework that comes from the textbooks. I thought the exams were fair.

Take this class with any other professor. She is so difficult when it comes to assignments and what she wants and also wastes so much class time. She weighs participation and attendance more than the loads of daily homework or even the exams. No one gets a perfect score on participation which hurt my grade in the end.

There was a lot of homework and participation was mandatory but I learned a lot from her. If you're looking for an easy professor Alejandra isn't going to be the right professor for you but she genuinely cares about her students.

Super fun in class and very dedicated to getting to know her students and having a good time in a learning environment. Only bump in the road was a technology issue between us that she wouldn't accept even after we found out what went wrong. Was the difference between an A and an A- unfortunately.

She was a very compassionate prof, always believed in her students. You have to put in the effort to get grades, there are a lot of small things to learn. In class participation is a must, but for good reason, helps you learn faster. She speaks mostly in spanish, but if you pay attention, it makes sense based on knowledge and context clues.

Half of the time she spoke I could not understand the words she was saying, and she rarely spoke English. This was one of the toughest classes I have taken, not because of the material, but because of her disregard for a learning curve, and she honestly seemed like she thought we were all native speakers. Her grading is tough, but she means well.
Professora desconsiderada . Literally take this class with anybody else. As somebody who is funding these professors and the university, you deserve the best and most compassionate educators.

SHE DOES NOT SPEAK ENGLISH.... DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU CANNOT UNDERSTAND FLUENT SPANISH. YOU NEED TO PARTICIPATE TO GET CREDIT!! 15 points for each unit is based on participation, she rarely gives out 15/15s, Very small class, with 13 people. tests and quizzes weren't horrible. Be sure to have a lot of Spanish knowledge prior to this class

Genuinely enjoyed her as the semester went on. I wasn't good at spanish in the least bit and still managed an A- because of her. She preps you well for all of the big tests and assignments. You can tell she cares about her students and creates a positive classroom environment.

This class is fast paced and she mostly speaks in Spanish, but it's a great way to practice your listening skills. She seemed to genuinely enjoy teaching us and it was a fun class. The homework is mostly busywork but not hard to get through and is good practice. Study the material and participate often and you'll do great

She runs through the lectures very quickly and speaks Spanish most of the time, so you definitely have to listen and pay attention to what she says. Her class structure was pretty solid. She really cares about her students.

An alright spanish professor. Native speaker so speaks in spanish 90% of the time. Gets very frustrated and mad if the whole class doesnt participate for every single question. Exams tend to have a lot of questions containing stuff she doesnt go over or suggest you study which was pretty frustrating. lots of little hw assignments due every day.
Many people felt they were treated like they were stupid at some points. Most of the time, she just ran through the subjects and practices. Very good at getting students involved!

Really good professor that cares about her students. Participation matters a lot, but participating is what helps you the most to understand the information. I took a lot of spanish in high school so this class was mostly a review for me which made it easier, but my classmates that had less spanish experience struggled. The tests can be hard.

Gives individual focus very well but can be a bit hard to understand and rushes through things that make the course material easier to understand. Expect to put in out-of-class work before every single class. Nice in nature and very flexible. Likes to wait to upload things like grades or announcements (got the syllabus 20 minutes before 1st class).

I can tell she's a very nice person who cares about teaching Spanish, but I don't know if she's a good teacher. Talking in rapid fire Spanish constantly with vocabulary the class won't know unless they're a native speaker isn't crazy helpful. HW is mostly busywork. Very strict on participation and attendance.

Do NOT take her class if you're a beginner Spanish speaker. She gets mad when you don't understand her or get a question wrong in class. She speaks way too fast and if you ask her to slow down, she tells you to get used to it. I enjoyed Spanish class until I had her as a professor.

Awesome teacher! A lot of the homework was busy work but you need to get them done on time to get a good grade. She spoke in Spanish all the time but cared for her students by asking us to evaluate her anonymously every few weeks so she could change the way she taught. Gets off topic sometimes but a fun class if you do some work for it!

Alejandra is not a good Professor. In a class of 20 people, not a single one of us received perfects on participation despite consistent participation on whole class and small group levels. When confronted she claimed it was because we dont raise our hands for EVERY question. Very frustrating and hard to work with. Take the class with someone else

I loved Alejandra's class. She was very supportive of all of her students and it was clear she wanted us to succeed. She made it very clear from the beginning of the semester. She even started to give us nicknames. She is a tough grader, but if you do the assignments and participate in class you'll be fine.

Most of the class/online homework is just busy work. She grades based on completion and participation a lot. She is receptive to her student's suggestions to the class. Dedicates several classes to review for exams/quizzes. 2 midterms. 1 final. 1 one-page paper. 2 talk-abroad conversations. Online homework every week. 2 quizzes. Daily textbook HW.

Grades participation/attendance. Sweet lady, easy to confront. Rearranges desks into 2 semicircles and often makes you get up/interact with everyone and, while weird, it did make learning more comfortable. E-textbook comes with online hw access code. Online hw weekly/easy. Explains concepts well, I'd love to have her again.

Her class was easy enough but I also took Spanish in high school and it was review to me- I have a feeling if I didn't have a background, I'd be screwed. She will often break into a tangent in Spanish, which is frustrating. If you don't do your homework, she'll call you out and is harsh. Very particular grader. Not my favorite professor.

One of the more frustrating teachers I've had at Ohio State so far, as she has absolutely no organization in her class at all. She goes off on long tangents during class in Spanish, which are difficult to understand for non-native speakers. She does mean well and wants her students to learn, but overall a lecturer that I would not choose again.

Her English is pretty good, no need to be scared of people who dont speak English as a first language guys. The class is pretty straight forward, do the assignments she assigns daily (she doesnt read them but does make sure theyre done). She doesnt really have a clearly outlined syllabus which can be annoying. Tests are easy if you keep up.

Alejandra is a very kind person and has very good intentions during class  however, when you don't do your homework, she gets mad (which is understandable). While she does speak in Spanish for most of class, which is difficult for new learners, it definitely improved my listening skills. If you actually want to learn Spanish, take it with her!

Worst professor/instructor I have ever had in my life. She is extremely unorganized and forgetful as she often looses track of what we are working on in class. She does not understand english well at all and does not understand computers or carmen. Spent almost every class going well over time and yelling at students. Avoid at all costs!

I dont think I have dreaded a class more. She never spoke English which made it difficult for someone who never took a foreign language. It was very intimidating. No extra credit and she was the toughest grader. I dont think she cares if you pass or fail. She is funny sometimes but you better have your homework done or she will be so rude to you
An excellent professor that really cares about her students. If you put effort into the class and participate, you'll do well.
Alex was my favorite professor of the semester! She got to know us on a personal level and I looked forward to going to Spanish every day. I wish I could have her again!

Alex is nice, but she frustrated me. She won't use Carmen, so you can't really see Your grades. She made us buy an online package, but the exercises didn't end up being helpful or count towards my grade. She also made her 5 question quizes worth the same amount as her exams, so getting 4 out of 5 right has the same weight as an 80 on an exam

This was her first semester teaching level 1 Spanish. It was a little rough but she makes what is going to be on the exams crystal clear. She is a very funny and fun person to be around. Very passionate about Spanish and requires her students to show her enthusiasm as well.

She is an awesome professor, and very passionate. She grades super easily and tries to help you on exams if you watch her as she does speaking parts. Yes, there is "busy work" homework every night, but its honestly so easy it shouldn't take more than 10 minutes, if that. The exams are super easy, exactly what you do in class. Easy A.

She is OK. It feels like she doesn't like her students. Somewhere, deep down in her Spanish soul there lies a nice woman, but she sure as hell doesn't come out in class.  Homework for the class is convoluted and confusing at times. Midterms are very straightforward though. Attendance is kinda mandatory but you won't want to skip class anyway
She assigns stuff ALL THE TIME, EVERYDAY.  The attendance is mandatory and you will get points deducted.  However, she is really fair if you miss class and really trys to help you pass her class

Alejandra is funny and makes an effort to get to know you if you show interest in the class. The topics are all presented logically in ppts that are easy to understand. Exams are very easy if you spend an hour or two looking over the review ppt. If you are okay at spanish, I highly recommend her.

Alex is a very kind and helpful professor. She goes over all the material while making sure that everyone understands. She prepares very well for the exams. There is almost nightly homework, but most of it is easy points.

This course is demanding per the department. Alejandra is firm but fair. She does her best to be fair with HW assignments and grading examsassignments. She does a GREAT job at preparing students for the exams. She really does want her students to learn. Reading, HW, & participation are a must.

I loved this class! Alejandra did an excellent job of preparing us for exams. While there was a fair amount of work & quite a few quizzes, it all did a great job of preparing us for exams. My Spanish improved greatly over the semester. She compiled study guides for every exam & helpful in-class projects for us to practice. Highly recommended!

Wonderful, caring teacher. My mother became very ill and she was the only one of my teachers to make sure I was ok, and to adjust deadlines. She talks fast, but uses lots of body language. Review the slides! Whatever she tells you to focus on for the tests, will be on the test in the exact manner she told you it would be. Very straightforward.

Angulo's class was the one class I dreaded going to every morning. I felt she didn't take into consideration that her class is part of my GPA and is willing to dock points wherever. She speaks very fast and treated us like children. She never clearly stated the homework then would be made if someone did not understand.

No clue why on earth anyone has given her this much credit. Spanish was fun and comprehensive until Angulo's class. Everyone in my class was confused on assignments and very intimidated by her. Students were afraid to speak up and ask for help. She is speeds through lecture and is easily irritated. Highly recommend avoiding her

Alex is really sweet and funny once she gets comfortable with your class. She tries to make sure she's clear before moving on. She does have a tendency to speak quickly, but if you let her know, she slows down. She's kind of quirky in a foreign way but its precious and makes it easy to get through the class.
Ms. Angulo is enthusiastic about the subject matter and has a great sense of humor. Although, she is very disorganized  and rushes through the course work, barely giving you time to take notes.
Love this woman to death. She's a phenomenal teacher. She even asked me to babysit her children. Haven't had a better prof for Spanish and I'm in 4557.20 currently.

Tons of homework. Alejandra is helpful, but can be rude. Book is used quite often and so is the online site to do homework. Her reviews are amazing, but are tedious. Seemingly fair grader at times. Mandatory attendance! after 5 absences she takes off 1% of final grade for each day. Overall, very irritating but a decent teacher.
Alex is so hard to understand. I struggled in this class simply because she never spoke english.  If you cannot follow along with constant Spanish, avoid her class at all costs.
I don't know what these other people are talking about. Alejandra was difficult to understand, scatter-brained, and treated us like children. Would not recommend her as an instructor.
She has so much energy! Such a sweetheart. The tests were extremely easy, but remember to study for the writing composition portions (don't worry- she grades very kindly).
She tried to make the class interesting and was very helpful if you were confused on anything.  She was really funny too!  I would recommend her to anyone looking to take a language class at night.

She was cool. Totally willing to help students, if you are nice to her she will be nice to you. Those that complained about her were just trying to get done with the class and thus did not respect her. For a 2 hr night class she makes it bearable and and easy A if you pay attention to her..
Great teacher who loves her students succeeding in class and also always has something funny to say. Great teacher! Get her!
She is a great Spanish teacher and actually cares about helping us learn.
Sometimes she was difficult to understand, but she made sure to repeat things.  She was always willing to help during her office hours and tended to be really funny during class.

LOVE LOVE LOVE her!! She is great at her job. Great at explaining topics. She keeps the class fun and upbeat. Great energy. There is a little bit of daily homework and a good amount of assignments, but as long as you do everything and put in some effort, you'll be good.
She was wonderful! She helped everyone and really cared. You could always ask her questions and she was so nice. Even though there is a lot of homework she will always help you if you ask!!!

He is VERY chill, nice, and genuinely tried to make his class funny and relatable. He does call on everyone (even if you don't raise your hand) but you can literally say you don't know and he'll just move on. Just show up to class, participate when called on, do ur HW, study for the exams, and I PROMISE you'll do fine in his class. No complaints.

Cesar is amazing, easily my favorite professor so far. He's a load of fun and such an enjoyable person to be around, and was really great at teaching. He was always super helpful and had no problem staying after class to help a student, or doing a meeting outside of normal office hours, and loved helping students and loves teaching.

Goofy can be a curse. I had zero prior Spanish knowledge...with only a few weeks left in the semester, I still have none. If you could pass Spanish 1 in your sleep & want to breeze by, he's your guy. If you have no knowledge, you'll suffer. Immensely. Every class will feel 'fun' until they don't anymore...until they feel like a waste of your time.

Cesar is awesome, his lectures are very funny as he will tell random stories about his family, hometown, etc. The class is very easy and he is a very easy grader. If you try at all, you will get a good grade.

I loved Dra. Podalsky's Latin American Film Studies course! While she is a tough grader compared to some other professors within the department, she truly cares about her students developing into better film critics and filmmakers. Participation is mandatory and you'll get more out of the class if you participate. Truly one of my favorite classes!

This class is heavy on the lectures and less heavy on actually learning. I checked out a few weeks before the end of the semester and I'm doing fine. The only assignments that really matter are the two essays you'll write which are absurd in length and too broad in topic.

There are participation points in a class of around 50, which I found distracting. You'll learn stuff, but don't expect to get an A without going the extra mile. Does care about teaching, her students and her content.

I do NOT recommended Dr. Podalsky. She makes it extremely difficult (seemingly on purpose) to get an A. She is a harsh grader. I have spent so much time and devotion on all papers/ big projects, and have never received above an 93, averaging about a 89/90.

Dr. Podalsky taught interesting films & theories most of the time. Classes are largely discussion-based, and your opinion and knowledge of the material matter. you are graded by like 4/5 midterm-style essays and participation, but she doesn't grade too harshly on the essays, she just wants to make sure you understand the material in my experience.

3 essays throughout the semester - first one is 3 pages, second is 6 pages, and last one is 9 pages. 1 to 3 films plus 3+ readings per week. Readings are long and I couldn't even understand them in English. Reading guides took me more than 2 hours to finish. I have a 4.0 in all my Spanish courses and this one was way too much work.

Very tough grader, but felt like grades were improved significantly after meeting with her. Final grade is 85% papers. Very interesting in lecture but readings are long and difficult to understand. Definitely make sure you completely understand what the assignments are looking for and if not, run your ideas by her, or else you will fail.
Lots of reading for a film class.  Grading is tough if you don't use enough examples.  Expects a lot from responses in only a few sentences.  Only one exam and 2 papers.  Overall not too bad.

Intimidating presence--just the air about her; she's nice enough, but a fairly tough grader.  Class lectures and reading had little to do with grades.  Film expert, uses Power Point extensively and focuses on discussion to a lesser extent.  Very few graded assignments.
Great professor who cares for his students.

Lis is a very caring professor. Sometimes it was a bit hard to understand some of the expectations for the exams/quizzes and learning grammar was a bit challenging. She is a very kind person though and really does want her students to do well!

Very kind professor. She is very happy and loves to play Spanish music and talk about the cultures. Not the best at explaining the little exceptions in Spanish grammar but she tries her best. I know Spanish but if I didn't, I would find the class to be a little harder but not difficult by any means. Still, she is a good teacher overall.

Amazing professor. Cares that people participate and tries to involve as many people as she can. The exams can be challenging, but everything is covered in class and she does good at preparing people for them

The slides she would use to lecture were sometimes a little all over the place, but she's very helpful with questions. Just simply never take the 5:30-7:20 tues/thurs class, it's actually terrible-not her fault tho. She did assign daily hw, but usually wasn't bad, and she grades easy on written stuff.

Professor Pearce was the best Spanish professor I have had at Ohio State. He teaches everything you need to know to do well in the class and even tells you what to focus on for quizzes and midterms. In addition, he does 1-2 class days of review before every exam. There is typically daily homework, but it is quick to complete.

I loved Anthony. Super friendly and really prepares you for the exams. I am not confident or good at Spanish and I think he understands that most people in this course are not taking Spanish based on interest. I would really recommend him if you have to take this course!

Anthony is genuinely the best professor I ever took. I suck at Spanish, like so bad, but he is wonderful. He is so reassuring and makes you feel so smart. Spanish has always been difficult for me but he makes it such a safe and comforting environment. I can not stress this enough if he is an option for your professor, pick him!

Prof. Pearce is great at connecting with students and breaking down different Spanish concepts. He makes it very clear that he is available if needed outside of class, and he is super understanding and easy to talk to if you run into any difficulties or need help. However, I did feel like the content in the second half of the semester felt rushed.

Professor Pearce was probably one of my favorite professors during undergrad. He gives you as many points as possible and is easily accessible outside of class. He genuinely cares about the well-being of his students. He has to follow several guidelines of the Spanish department, but other than that, as long as you attend class, you should do great

Senor Pearce genuinely cares about the success and well-being of his students. He is phenomenal at explaining grammatical concepts and providing various examples. While the course is structured by the department (pay attention to Spanish cultural topics for exams), he does a great job preparing students for said exams.

Class was so easy and extremely manageable. No tests at all just online quizzes that are open note and you get 3 attempts, and a final project and paper (very easy). The lectures are helpful but the online quizzes are over a video not the lecture. She was so nice and I enjoyed her class a lot and would definitely recommend her to anyone

Nieves Rivera is great professor. A lot of the 1103 class is studying vocab and learning to write well in Spanish. She makes sure you understand the material and is very interesting to talk to. Highly reccomend

They do a fantastic job of keeping you engaged. Works with your schedule and accepts late work. Is very generous and reasonable with deadlines. No exams! Just a final project where they are available to help and answer as many questions as you need!! Loved talking about real world instances and examples of grammar and overall is a great class!

This class is easy and informative. I learned so much about the inner workings of Spanish grammar (it's like a linguistics class). We had no exams- just online open-note quizzes and a final group project. Favorite Spanish class I've had at OSU thus far!

Professor Babel is one of the best professors I have ever had. I took this class as a GE and really enjoyed it. The homework assignments were very easy and fun to do. There are no tests as well, but class participation/attendance is most of your grade. Definitely would recommend taking it to knock out a GE or Theme.
If you are interested in the topic, she is an amazing teacher. However, if you are taking a class just to fill out your degree requirements, she can be a bit much.

A very intelligent and nice professor who expects very high quality work from her students. Lots of little essays and expects participation in every lecture, but if you are willing to buckle down and put in the work it will be extremely rewarding. I learned so much!

one of the best human beings to exist. shes so caring & truly wants you to learn through non-traditional methods. she emphasizes the importance of learning a language through dialogue and real-world examples. loves to converse about linguistics & is relatable. provides awesome feedback on assignments

Profe Babel is a professor who understands the heavy workload her students are under and accommodates them. She was very encouraging to students who spoke out in class, even if their Spanish wasn't perfect. She used class time extremely well with little out of class work. I learned more in this Spanish class than any other I have taken.

I really enjoyed Professor Babel, she definitely expects you to speak in Spanish and attendance is mandatory. The textbook was a must, used in class everyday. MY course was a composition course, so it was about an essay every 2 weeks, not bad. If you give her honest feedback about class, she's very willing to be flexible. Great teacher.

She is very intelligent and a hard worker, and she expects no less from her students. Come prepared with high energy, if you feel intimidated, don't freak out, most of the students did too. She can be a little curt, cold, and rough around the edges at times so pass her class the first time. My least favorite professor, but you will learn a lot.

Quizzes on Carmen are slightly confusing, and a paper due every other week. If you turn everything in on time and come to class, you'll get an A. An interesting class and a wonderful teacher very interested in teaching.
Most interesting class I've taken at OSU, she genuinely cares too
Very helpful, but oftentimes her class is confusing. She grades really hard on homework and projects, but the tests are easy. My best advice would be to ask questions if you are confused.

I took this class for a GE credit and regretted it a lot. On the first day of class, 50 people were enrolled, and on the last day, 20 people were enrolled. She is a very harsh grader and requires you to attend almost 90% of all classes. You also have to participate a lot. She does not communicate expectations clearly or care about teaching.

I think 1155 was an annoying class, but wasn't super difficult. Dr. Franco made the lectures fun, but participation is absolutely necessary in her class. I think she is a good professor, and I think any issues I had were more so with the department and their requirements. Having taken 3 years of Spanish is high school though, the class wasn't bad.

The quizzes/tests/papers are VERY influential on your grade. It isn't very easy to get a mid-high A in 1151. She is a good teacher, but this course requires a lot of attention outside of class. Don't take 1151 from her if you aren't committed to Spanish! It is absolutely an intensive class.

Try your absolute best to avoid her. Wow, absolutely terrible instructor. Super unorganized, extremely rude, just throws an insane amount of busy work for an entry-level spanish course, grades like its a PHD course. Just don't take her. I know spanish and don't get me wrong, 1103 is supposed to be easy, but she makes it like the military.

Class started off full (25 students) within the first 3 days the class was (12 people). He cannot use powerpoint and has struggled opening it for 20 minutes at times. He rarely speaks english, and when he does, it is very broken. Class consists of him asking constant questions in spanish that seem irrelevant often. I would recommend switching.

He is very hard to understand. He speaks fast, heavily accented, and very quietly. He uses words not taught in Spanish 1 and 2 and expects you to know them. He is not familiar at all with department policy regarding 1000 level Spanish classes. Two-thirds of the class dropped within the first week because they couldn't hear him when he spoke.

Profe Morató is seriously amazing. He is a 86 year old man that is very mobile and has a great personality. He is very active and energetic. I think of class as if you're talking to your grandpa. You talk and talk but eventually you get to the answer. Super easy! I recommend going to his office hours! He is fun and easy going! GREAT TEACHER!

I took her 4 week Span. 3401 class. Thought it was going to be too much information to learn in 4 weeks, however, she explained everything so clearly, and the homework was actually helpful -- not just busy work. I highly recommend her if you need to take this class. She is one of the best Spanish profs I've had.

One of the best professors I've had at OSU. Extremely knowledgeable in her field and seems genuinely interested in the subjects covered in this course. In addition, she is hilarious and brings energy to each and every lecture.

Very helpful and the lectures are full of detail. She posts all the presentations online and gives a pretty straight forward study guide. Only 2 big exams with some smaller quizzes. She is very easy to understand and is funny too. If you just review your notes from class you should be fine on the quizzes and tests.

Such a great teacher, I learned more Spanish in one semester than three years prior. Having a native speaker helps a lot. Gave us plenty of info about the exams, what to practice and answered questions in class, through email, and office hours. Makes you participate and continually improve in Spanish. If you can take her class, take it!

Incredibly friendly and wonderful person! Truly cares about all her students. The class is challenging, but she is crystal clear in her teaching, and is always willing to lend a helping hand! she really goes above and beyond in terms of teaching. Wish i could take more classes with her!

She is a teacher genuinely interested in what she does. She is hilarious and does not drone on and on while she lectures. This class is a challenge, but the material is interesting and I enjoyed learning from a native speaker. Attend class and pay attention, and you will be golden.

Lorena is an amazing teacher. The class is difficult, but, if you show up and participate she will do everything she can to help you succeed and pass the course. Always available for help outside of class and is crystal clear about what she expects on the department standard tests. Also, she is extremely hot and her accent makes her even sexier

He's a sweet quirky little old man that has a true passion for the language. I tested out of one and barely knew or remembered anything going into 2, but ended up with a good grade. He is more than willing to help you if you ask!

Profe seemed very intimidating at first, but if you have taken any Spanish previously the class will not be bad. I took three years in high school, tested out of Spanish 1101, and I ended up with an A. Tenses are coversed rather quickly so if you struggle with that you may not do as well. He refused to use any English during class though.

Profe is a really, really nice man who is overly willing to help any student. He is very passionate about Spanish and wants all of his students to really understand the language. The class itself, which is dictated by the department, is challenging but he tries to make it as best as possible. He is fair with his grading and gives clear directions.
He's really nice but the class itself is completely useless.

This Teacher is extremely hard. He will mark you down for every little mistake spelling and pronunciation. It is nearly impossible to get an A in this class. Don't take. He discriminates against you if you have an accent and this is displayed in your spanish speaking.

Profe is a very nice old man with his quirks, however he acts like you want to major in Spanish. It is mainly solid Spanish, and does not offer English explanations unless the class begs him too. If you are just trying to pass a language go with another teacher.
If you really want to learn Spanish go with this guy. Otherwise, find one of the younger instructors that realize most of the people in their class are just trying to put a check in a box.

He is a good teacher and seems to care about his students. He is really nice and grades fairly. I wouldn't go so far as to schedule a class just to have him, but he is a good teacher to have. He starts out with a lot of homework but tapers off assigning it as the semester continues.

Rittberger is a great teacher. He is such a sweet guy. He would do anything for his students. I would definitely recommend taking a class with him. He is helpful if you need it. You will need to buy the textbook, but the class is really great.

Teacher is very nice and tries to keep a light mood in class. Grading is not very strict and teacher is rather "easy-going.". Not much HW (103.01). If you know Spanish, this should be an easy A- at least. Teacher does not always use Spanish (when he explains certain rules and stuff, he may speak English). If you have him, you should be happy.
He is a nice person, but too strict about the grades.
Quirky and likes to tell jokes that aren't always funny, but still a nice guy.

Soric was definitely one of my favorite teachers I've had so far. She realized that her class was a GE so she was very lenient on the amount of homework and test dates. Her tests are very easy as long as you read her power points and listen to the class discussion. She basically gives you all of the answers and she is really fun!
Kristina is awesome! I absolutely hated Spanish and she made me enjoy the class! She helps whenever necessary and truly cares about her students! Highly recommend!

Kristina is incredibly helpful.  She doesn't mess around with attendance and is sometimes all over the place due to the fact that she's a student herself.  She does what she can to make you successful in her class. Highly recommend her as a teacher.

By far the best foreign language teacher I have had. English is her native language and she has no problems repeating anything in English. Very fun and willing to help any student. Truly cares that her students learn Spanish. Highly recommend taking her course!
You want her for Spanish. She is American, talks in English when she knows we need to actually know what she's saying, is extremely easy-going, is fun, and just a good teacher. Highly recommend her.

Sra. Alex teaches her class in a very immersive style.  Lectures and assignments are all presented in Spanish, but she has no problem speaking English if you ask for it.  Most in class work involves conversations in Spanish, so its great to develop your speaking skills.  She's somewhat lenient on attendance, but don't miss too many
She was an extremely fair grader, sometimes I felt she was extremely easy. Homework everyday and checks it. Do your homework, come to class and you'll be fine

Allison seems like a very nice person in general, but often seems unprepared and scattered. Her lectures are poorly organized and jump around within each chapter, making it hard to know what to prepare for before class. Additionally, she is often rushed to finish what was planned for class as she spent too much time on arbitrary worksheets.

Allison is very sweet, easy to talk to and all her slides are online. If you miss something, you can find everything online. She takes small points off here in there for little mistakes, but I feel like she is a well grader. I would take this class again just to have her again. Homework is all online and all very easy.
She's very slow to grade papers and exams. Especially final exams.

Allison's class is pretty boring. She was very forgetful with marking you down for attendance, so make sure you take notes in class. She doesn't really do good with replying to emails at all and takes forever to give grades back.
Great professor. Wonderful person. Very helpful and has fun lectures. Not the easiest.

Allison is very friendly and really tries to help students understand the material. I don't get why others rated her so low, because from my experience, she is always willing to help. She grades pretty fairly, and as long as you go to class and do assignments, it's hard to do badly, although it'd be nice to see grades more often. Good teacher!

Allison is a great professor! This is one of my favorite classes this semester. It's really not very difficult to get an A if you put some effort into the class. She's very kind and helpful. Homework is not excessive. She's easy to understand and makes class activities interesting. Overall, she's been awesome!
I LOVE HER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  She is so nice and really goes out of her way to help you. I hope to have her for 1103.

Good person, not the best professor.  She takes about two extra weeks to give grades back; it's already time for finals and haven't seen things from the second week, so you never really know how you're doing.

Allison is very nice, her class however is not. It is very disorganized and she jumps from topic to topic without helping students to clearly understand the material. As stated in the other comment, she has a quiz at the beginning of each class which are worth a lot of points (typically 10).  Do yourself a favor, and avoid her class.

It is more of a chore to keep up with the numerous quizzes and homework in this class, even she can't keep up with it. She takes tons of points off for things you didn't even learn yet. Her "spanish accent" is difficult to understand as well. She never speaks english. Unless you are willing to work exceptionally hard for a C-, avoid if possible.

Laura is very nice. She doesn't like to waste time and will go through what she wants you to do for the class quickly. 1155 is a very fast paced class but easy if you put in effort and study. Overall I had a great experience with her and would take this class again.

Laura  is a really helpful, passionate and enthusiastic teacher who deeply cares about students, you can tell. She is kind of a hard grader because she expects students to succeed, but you have to work. She is super nice, understanding and will always have time for extra explanations, whether inside or outside of class. She is also really funny!

Laura teaches kind of quickly and expects students to know what's going on. Most of the time it's just stuff you can learn in the textbook or on the online homework, so I wouldn't worry. She's nice and understanding if you aren't getting something and will take the time to explain. Be prepared for culture questions to be on the tests/quizzes.

Laura is a great Spanish teacher! She's funny and she makes learning the language fun, I was never bored in her class. She does move quickly through the review of Spanish 1 material, so if you ended up in the class and you don't remember anything from high school at all, you might struggle. I know some kids that dropped for that reason.

Eleni is one of my favorite professors I have had since coming to OSU. She is so incredibly passionate about the material in class and that made it that much more enjoyable. Her quizzes and tests are very straight forward and she is very clear on the material you need to know. Would take more of her classes!

Overall a great professor. I had her for Advanced Spanish Grammar, and she was an exceptional professor. It was very easy to see how passionate she was about the material, but that didn't stop her from always keeping the focus on the students. She would always slow down if needed and could always give extremely clear explanations.

Eleni was probably one of my favorite spanish teachers here at Ohio State, she explained the material perfectly, but also expected you to know it before class started. She definitely doesn't hold your hand through the class, but I find that to be more to my liking.

Eleni is awesome, she speaks clearly and fluently which is obviously important.  Exams and quizzes are pretty easy.  If she doesnt know the answer to your question she will always go out of her way to figure it out.  There wasnt a single exam or quiz that had material that we didnt cover.  Only downside for some might be involuntary participation.
I was astounded with John Petrus, he is a fantastic person. He connects with the students and goes above and beyond to make sure everyone understands the material. I would highly recommend him.

Class consisted of 3 papers and one group project. However, participation and going to class mattered a lot. In order to be able to participate, there were a LOT of articles to read each week and a movie to watch each week. First few weeks of class, the movies were absolutely awful, but they started to get better. Recommend the class.
Professor Petrus was great. He grades fairly and doesn't give out easy A's, but he definitely tries to help you improve your Spanish. I enjoyed having him as a professor.

Petrus always explained readings very clearly in class, was very available to ask questions. Assigned very helpful worksheets. Homework load was very reasonable, did a great job of preparing us for exams & the SLRPE. Only complaint: the syllabus changed frequently, but the class was still pretty organized. I would recommend this teacher & class.

Celia is one of the best professors I've had. She really seems to care about the individual students themselves and takes an interest in the success of those students. She manages to make boring material incredibly interesting and is always highly energetic and passionate. I absolutely loved her class and would recommend her to anybody! I miss her!

Celia was so energetic and willing to answer questions and she brought so much of her personality to the classroom. The material was boring but she did her best to make it interesting and keep us engaged. She gave really good feedback on everything and was good at sending out emails to remind you of homework and upcoming projects.
Celia is amazing. She's energetic, passionate, and generally wonderful. I've never enjoyed a class more. I would definitely recommend her to anyone.

Celia is pretty amazing as teacher. She's energetic, understanding, informative and just plain awesome. She makes the material enjoyable by breaking up her lectures with small group discussions. Participation matters so be sure to either participate in lecture or in the small groups. She's a bit of a tough grader tho but ask her for feedback after!

Celia's Spanish class has been the best class I have taken at OSU. She is energetic and fun. She makes a boring subject really interesting. Attendance matters and there are participation points, however, if you talk to her she is very understanding. She answers back to emails quickly. I would absolutely recommend this class

I freaking love this woman. She is very comical to be around and although she may never actually know your name, she will totally help you if you at least pretend like you care.  I am not a great spanish speaker and was dreading this class, but I thought it was pretty easy and I actually even enjoyed it.
By far the easiest class I have taken so far at OSU
Great professor. Never really studied much in the class and still got an A. She is a very easy grader. As long as you show that you care, then she'll give you a good grade. Awesome person.

Gianna Pandolfi de Rinaldis is by far my favorite professor here at OSU. She made the class fun and was really easy going. If you needed help or were confused about the material, Gianna would make time to meet up with you and go over it one on one. I highly recommend Gianna for anyone taking Spanish.

Gianna Pandolfi De Rinaldis has to be the worst professor in the Spanish Department here at OSU... I legitimately regret not taking Italian for 3 semesters instead of Spanish for two.  Does not go over any of the material and just expects you to teach yourself this God forsaken language yourself.  Just a terrible teacher to be completely honest.

She is very nice and funny. She doesn't really explain what is going on in the class, though. I never knew what verb tense we were learning or when anything was due. The due dates weren't consistent with the syllabus. She definitely cares about her students, but never knowing what is happening in the class makes it very confusing.

I love Gianna. She is the most wonderful person I have known in my life. She make sure you are in track, she helps a lot and take time of her life to go and meet with you if you don't understand. Spanish was a wonderful experience with her. She use the book and power points. I will recomend her to anyone.

Gianna goes out of her way to make sure her students comprehend the material, and is truly passionate about teaching and helping.  She's also really easy to get along with, and likes to joke.  I would recommend taking her class(es).

Very funny teacher and always willing to help students! Expect to do a decent amount of work, but it helps in the long run. Plus, she wants you to get an A and will help you get that. Overall, a good class&teacher.

Gianna is hands-down the most entertaining, easy-going instructor I have had at Ohio State. She is a RIOT. If you have a positive attitude and accept her outrageous personality, you will love her. I got an A in her class without having to kill myself over studying or homework. She's the best.

So nice! Easy A too, if you do your work. Do your homework each night, she randomly checks, and it will help your grade (doesnt take too long) memorize vocab and youll do FINE on tests. super friendly, youll love her.

What a pain. You really need to be in the books for this class. Grades very strict, pages of homework every night that she sometimes checks, never knows what is on quizzes or exams because her department doesn't tell her apparently....rough class.

Dough Bush is a great guy and professor. He's nice and willing to help you if you ask for it. He assigns an oral presentation and weekly homework assignments, but nothing is challenging. He also assigns readings, but tells you about them in class. Basically the whole class was in English. It was easy, but a fun class. Get the online textbook.

Dr. Bush is my favorite professor I've had at OSU so far.  The class was ridiculously easy, but I still felt that I learned a lot.  He encourages participation, and the class's environment was so relaxed.  I'm glad I took his class my first semester ever because he really helped me feel comfortable with the transition.

He has been one of the coolest professors I've had so far at Ohio State. He's more than willing to help if you ask for it, and he'll even come to you if he can tell you need it. He's pretty much cool with whatever and he's a really nice guy if you talk to him. Grading is pretty clear cut and there are no surprises. Easy class and easy A.
He was definitely the best out of the 3 Spanish professors I've had. So helpful and a genuinely nice individual. I highly recommend him!

Doug is an awesome professor. He encourages any kind of participation, whether it is in English or Spanish, which allowed for a very welcoming and fun discussion environment. His exams were also quite easy if you attended class and did the readings. It is quite obvious that Doug wants his students to learn and succeed.
Really helpful teacher. Also, the class itself was incredibly easy and had a comfortable environment. Definitely enjoyed showing up! My favorite spanish teacher thus far at osu.
I have never had Doug as a teacher, but he was in the tutorial room everyday, and helped me.. he is great tutor so i can only imagine what he is as a teacher.. definately looking for his name for 104
I loved Doug Bush. He is a great teacher and so nice. He was very helpful. I'm shocked no one has posted a review. He was my favorite teacher and I HATE Spanish. He made me love it! Well...like it.

Valerie is a great teacher. It's obvious she could teach highly advanced Spanish classes, but she teaches this intro one so well also. She never has a problem answering questions, and is always willing to help if you ask for it. I actually look forward to this class everyday I have it. I would HIGHLY recommend her to anyone taking Spanish.
Very new to teaching but it's hard to tell because she is so incredibly patient, helpful and has full control over the class.

I really liked this class, it teaches actual Spanish that people speak not just the "proper" spaniard Spanish. The work is easy and you don't need to do any reading. The prof knows a lot about romantic structure and linguistics especially Spanish. She has a hard time explaining & translating from Spanish which makes it hard to understand concepts.
She made us grade tests during class because she wad "too busy". Not one student wanted to be in the class. Would not recommend.  Would not take again.

I did not have her in class, but I met with her frequently. She is very willing to help with an appointment. Keep in mind she has many other students to tend to who have made appointments, so expecting to meet with her whenever is unrealistic. She is very nice and responds quickly to emails.

The class itself is only 4 credit hours yet you meet 2 times a week for 1:48 just like 5 credit hour classes only 3 times more work. Christine was helpful and responded quickly to e-mails, but was a  very tough grader. Marked off for minor spelling errors, missing accents, etc THEY ADD UP FAST! Would not recommend her.

I was nervous b/c of the reviews, but I also was skeptical of them. It seemed weird that there would be 3 horrible posts one day and then 3 more a few days later. Christine was a very fair professor and responded quickly to e-mails. I asked about a quiz question in class, she later e-mailed me and had given me the points. Would have her again.

She is waaaay to overdramatic about this spanish lit class. She's constantly shouting, over-annunciating, and making wild arm gestures that give me nightmares. It is a terribly bland class, boring stories, easy tests, the SLRPE is a joke, and she just tries way too hard. We know its boring as crap, dont try to lie to us in an attempt to make it fun

This is by far the hardest class I have ever taken. The teacher barely knows Spanish, so it is very difficult to understand what she is talking about. She never offered help, and when I would go to her office for help, she would tell me she was too busy and ask me to leave. I am very disappointed that Ohio State hired someone like her.  AVOID

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! she is so unhelpful.  She is very rude when you get a question wrong.  The tests are impossible!  She gives you this easy review sheet, and when you get to the test it is NOTHING like the review sheet.  do not take her class, unless you want to do way more work than necessary for a 3 credit hour class.

she's still teaching?  She never paid attention to the class, and was constantly absent.  If she was there she was not helpful. there were always group activities, probably so she didnt have to help the class. she barely knew spanish at all!

She is the worst teacher in the entire university. I got a B, but that was with no help from the actual teacher.  I had to go elsewhere for help because this teacher never offered her time.  I do not recommend this class, unless you feel like doing a lot of useless work. this teacher makes you feel stupid.  she does everything she can to make you f

Christine is awesome. She is very helpful and a fairly lenient grader. I don't know what the other rater is talking about. She is completely fluent in Spanish and knows her stuff. I would recommend her to anyone.

she was the worst teacher i ever had. completely ruined spanish for me. she can barely speak spanish herself. next time you put me in a spanish class, at least make it be with someone who can speak the language!

He keeps class entertaining and interesting. Reading helps but he covers everything with his powerpoints (posts online). If you study his quizzes and exams aren't hard. He is really knowledgable and is very relaxed while teaching. You can tell he loves what he does and wants everyone to pass.

I was a horrible student. Disconnected from the academic world while trying to get by in real life. Life really challenged me and school was not my priority. However Spanish was my passion and Mr. Morgan saw that. He challenged me, he didn't let me slip by. A great freaking guy. He writes his own texts and they are great. Still have 5 years later.

There isn't enough space to extol Dr. Morgan on any site. He is so brilliant, so kind and warm you will leave wanting more classes with him! His book Sonidos en Contexto is a major resource and should be used in intro Span courses. Should you need help outside of class, he is there or will get to you somehow. A professor who has tenure for a reason
I love Professor Morgan. He's always so willing to help you out, he tells great stories about his suegra, and he seems to really enjoy teaching. One of my favorite professors I've ever had.

Professor Morgan is hands down the best teacher I've ever had at Ohio State. He knows the material like the back of his hand (and he wrote the book), so he definitely knows what he's talking about. If you go to class, you learn everything you need to know. And he's incredibly helpful and willing to take time out of his day help you.

Absolutely an amazing professor! He really makes you think and understand the phonetics of spanish. I would recommend this class and teacher to anyone. He is very intelligent and always willing to help!

One of my favorite, if not my favorite, teachers. This class ended up being incredibly interesting. You do need to study for this class, but if you care about your spanish at all this class will be incredibly helpful. I will I could take another class with him but I will be graduating. : (

Amazing professor.  By far my favorite professor at OSU, and I've been here for 4 years now.  Not extremely easy, but if you are even half awake and at class, you'll learn a ton from him.  Really reasonable in grading.

I had Rebeka for SPAN 3404 (Pronunciation) and was excited to have her again for linguistics. Her homework and quizzes are set up just like her exams, she answers questions inside/outside of class. Extremely knowledgable. She teaches from her powerpoint but has partner activities to do in order to stay engaged. Absolutely loved her as a professor.
She is really helpful and good at what she does. I enjoyed coming to class everyday and I´m really glad I took this class with her. I am taking another class with her next semester

LOVED this class.  Attendance was "mandatory", but everyone received 100% in attendance at the end of the quarter.  She is super nice and helpful, definitely wants her students to do well.  I'm taking a class with her again next quarter!
Such a great teacher, truly loves the subject and treats students with respect.  10/10 would take her class again.

I love Srta. Ramos! She was such sweet heart and genuinely cared about her students. I not only learned a lot about Spanish language but Spanish culture as well. She inspired me to get a Spanish minor! I did have a background in Spanish so for people who didn't take a lot of Spanish in high school , it may be difficult but she will offer to help!

I LOVE HER! She made class so fun and it was so interesting. She talked a lot about Spain, where she is from, which was fascinating. Class was very easy for me, as I took spanish in HS, however it would be a lot of work for someone who was new to spanish. Lots of homework and assignments to keep you busy. She is very sweet, caring, and laid back.
Great professor. Can't recommend enough
She puts all of her effort towards the success of her students. Her patience, effort, willingness to explain are all on point. If you want an A, take her class.
Really wants her students to succeed.  Definitely one of the best instructors I have had at the university.
great teacher i'd definitely recommend her. you'll learn a lot about spanish and she's a good person. lot of homework but I think that's standard for the spanish department.
She's super helpful and does lots of activities in class to help with understanding.

Great and caring professor who wants you to do well.  Class goes over present, preterit, and beginning of imperfect. Lecture slides are posted, but is mandatory to show up. Participation is required, like all Spanish courses. Class is not hard. 2 Quizzes, 1 MidTerm, and a Final. She speaks English well and also knows what she is doing.
Irene is very sweet and enthusiastic. Taking Spanish with her is honestly not hard at all. She's also pretty good looking.
Irene is the sweetest, most helpful professor out there. She is amazing. If you have the chance to take a Spanish class with her, do it.

Professor Marquez is very patient, which is key when teaching a foreign language. She genuinely wants you to succeed--there are four compositions, and you get to turn in rewrites for each one. The initial and revision grades are then averaged together. You learn from your mistakes and get to fix them, too :)

Class is all reading stories and you have to read them before class so you can participate in discussion.  The stories can be difficult so try to find a translated version online or just try to copy and paste it into google translate to get the gist of the story. Read stories, go to class, and listen to discussion about story - thats the exams.

Christian is a really fun prof. He's very upbeat and a joy to listen to. His lectures are rarely boring. We watched two del Toro movies as well. Three exams, one paper, and two weekly 400wc discussions on Carmen. Overall, if you're interested in Spain and don't mind a little work you'll enjoy his class.
Good teacher and a nice guy. Class is pretty easy to get an A in as long as you try. I wish OSU had more like him.

Christian is super relaxed and wants you to be successful. He comes into class with a smile on his face and genuinely cares about his students. It is a very chill atmosphere, mostly with discussion among groups of students then sharing your thoughts with the whole class. Discussion posts each week but that's about it homework wise. Great class!

Awful. 2 discussion posts a week 400 words each which is very time consuming. He didn't say one word about our exam or 5 page essay before or after they were due. Midterm wasn't super hard but he takes a lot of points off and doesn't right one word why on essays/extended response questions. Very boring-it's like a literary analysis class in Spanish

The class is laid out in a discussion format; it creates a natural environment for speaking Spanish. Attendance is mandatory. You miss a day? You quickly get behind. He is very helpful, understanding, funny, & approachable. He is from Spain & has a lot of storiesexamples to help you learn the language & the culture. Read before class. Cool dude!:)

I enjoyed taking Spanish 3401 (advanced grammar) with Dr. Johnson. She is a very good professor, and genuinely cares about her students. She is very nice and approachable, and it is easy to ask questions in class. Her notes are helpful and she posts them online so it is easy to go back and review for exams. Highly recommend this course!
Not a very interesting class at all but she's a very nice and helpful teacher. I always felt I could approach her if I needed help or to ask a question.
Such a nice teacher! The actual material isn't the most fun but she makes it more interesting. Definitely take this class with her!

Mrs. Johnson is a fun, young and exciting teacher!! She seems genuinely interested in seeing her students succeed. She is also very helpful and approachable. Class itself is sort of hard and you def have to study in order to do well but it's not bad. Loved her!! :)
Great teacher, very helpful and makes things clear!

Mary is a great teacher, I'd definitely recommend her for anyone whether you're just moving along in the intro  series, or if it's been a few years since you took Spanish. She makes a point of switching to English every now and then to make sure everyone understands the material.....She's a Fair Grader.... Gives interesting info beyond the book.

Mary is a really fun teacher who is genuinely interested in teaching!  She really wants her students to do well in her class!  I would suggest taking this class to anyone wanting to major/minor in Spanish!
Really helpful teacher. Prepares you adequately for the exams and whatnot. Everyone got a solid grade. Slow pace but not boring. And she's a cutie.
I LOVED her!!! I had her last fall and I still wish she was teaching 250. She is such a great teacher!!
Awesome teacher. Very helpful and understands the busy life of a student. One of the best teachers at the university.

Mary is very helpful and cares about her students.  She wants you to learn and is always available to help you out.  I highly recommend her class to anyone.  I didn't like Spanish much before her class and now I'm considering a minor!

Super great. If we weren't given enough time or a test seemed unfair she was incredibly understanding and tried to be as leaant as possible. My knowledge of the subject is increased drastically!!! SHE'S GREAT!
Mary goes above and beyond to help you out!  She does fun things in class and is a VERY good teacher!!
No Comments
Mary is an awesome, extemely helpful Spanish teacher. I learned more in a quarter with her than I did in four years of my high school Spanish.
No Comments

Brad is a really great instructor and genuinely cares about his students and their success. If you aren't satisfied with a grade just talk to him about it and he will look over it again, since he knows he is a tough grader but wants to help as much as possible. Can come off as intimidating and somewhat rigid at times, but is truly kind and caring.

Brad has high expectations but he makes up for it by putting a lot of effort and passion into his lectures.  This definitely isn't one of those spanish classes where you can be entirely lazy and get an A.
Alright professor. Cares for the subject.

I was really worried about going into Spanish 3401 right out of high school but she made it a great transition. She is really big on making sure you understand the material so after she explains everything in Spanish, she goes over it in English too.   The tests and quizzes aren't too bad if you study.
What an angel. Brilliant woman. Very sweet and kind in class. Easy grader if you care about that sort of thing. Don't think twice about learning with her.
Mary is great! She's really, really nice and helpful. She assigned a bunch of homework at the beginning of our class, but she weaned off of it toward the end, so make sure you study.
Extremely clear. If you attend class and pay attention, you're golden. Lots of extra credit on tests and quizzes.

I honestly had a difficult time acclimating to Spanish classes. After testing out of 101 & 102, I was expecting death via Spanish. Surprisingly, Mary provided the opposite. It was a safe environment to learn the language and appreciate it. If you want the best teacher in the Spanish dept., it's Mary. She's easy on the eyes and very fun to boot! ;]
Great teacher with a super easy class. Loved every bit of it, he's definitely worth taking!
he was really good and easy to understand
He was amazing, I would definitely recommend him
He was so good. Definitely recommend!
Awesome professor. Very clear about what you need to know for exams and is more than willing to help.

Great instructor, learned a lot. The lectures were great and very entertaining. I had no spanish experience prior to taking this course and now I feel like I've got a good foundation! I would definitely recommend him as a teacher :)

Another great Spanish professor at OSU! Young guy, extremely professional, and very clear about what you have to know. Explains very clearly and thoroughly and prepares you well for the tests with very entertaining lectures! Collects homework randomly, not a problem if you keep up. Very generous grader as well. Took like 0 notes and aced each exam.

Amazing teacher!  He made it so that attending class and doing homework was enough to learn the material well.  It required little motivation on my part.  Can't say the same of my 103 teacher, who doesn't even give quizzes.  You would think that would be a good thing, but...
Such a fantastic teacher!!
Amazing professor!

He was a really great teacher, and he was very clear about everything he taught. Despite the fact that the class is taught in the different language, he will explain things in as many ways possible until everyone understands. I highly recommend him as a teacher.
jason is the man, does great job of preparing you for the exams. pretty easy grader too!
good professor genuinely interested in teaching
Real cool guy, just a American guy teaching some Spanish...very nice, very helpful, not a harsh grader...I am awful at Spanish and I feel comfortable in his class....recommend!
I had him for 103.66 definitely an easy grader. He is a nice guy and pretty easy to understand when he speaks spanish. Would recommend him.

I had him for Spanish 103.66. He speaks English as him main language so it is very easy to listen to him speak in Spanish. We had easily four homework workbook assignments per night in which he took several for a grade. He graded fairly and it was easy to strive for an A+.
I had him for 103.66. Super nice guy, and the class was really easy. He's always willing to help, and as long as you try you're good to go.

I had Jason for my Spanish 103.66 class and he was the man. Always really clear with what he's trying to teach us, always really helpful with everyone in the class. Definitely recommend him to anyone and everyone.

Ana Lovely is wonderful, she genuinely cares about the students and is very willing to help you with any problems you have. Speaks pretty clearly so it's not hard to keep up in class, and assignments aren't too bad. Very nice lady.
She was a great teacher! She genuinely cares about her students and is very helpful.  Great class!
Awesome teacher! She's very helpful and makes class fun. I absolutely recommend her!
Makes it clear what is expected of her students. Pushes her students to use Spanish in the classroom. Is very helpful to students who seek it. If you can get her as your prof, do it.
103.66 was a major review of high school material. It was a really fun class and my classmates were awesome. I didn't get the best grade, but the class was a great refresher.
One of the best teachers I've ever had! Truly interested in all of her students and is very helpful and clear in explaining things. Does a variety of activities in class and is extremely motivated.
Great teacher! Would definitely recommend her over any other spanish professor. Study a little and get an A.
very friendly and helpful. authentic spanish speaker too
She is a very good teacher. She is actually interested in teaching and helping her students. She is my favorite professor from OSU so far!

Probably one of the nicest profs I've ever had! She is a great teacher who really cares. The tests are completely predictable, so just study and they'll be easy. You're allowed 4 absences before it starts affecting your grade, but that's the department's rule, not hers.

Profesora Lovely is such a great teacher. Im trying to get her for span103! Shes always willing to help you and does alot of class activities to help you understand. I highly recomend her! Shes adorable and soo sweet!
No Comments
AWESOME! Really nice and really teaches you spanish, do the homework and review guides for tests and youll be fine

As a professor, Meghan is great. She is nice, and she knew what she was talking about. However, the title of 404's class was very misleading. The class mostly deals with phonetics rather than pronunciation. Having absolutely no experience with this material, I struggled a lot. It's hard enough to learn this stuff in English, let alone Spanish.

Very helpful and cooperative if you have any problems. After taking Spanish since 8th grade, I finally have a firm grasp of how to use direct/indirect object pronouns. As long as you go to class and put forth a decent effort, the class should be an easy A. Overall a fun and relatively easy class.

By far the best Spanish teacher I've had. Really great with explaining distinct reasonings why we use various structures. Was initially intimidated by this course because I don't normally feel grammar is my strong point, but the class was well organized and I was successful in gaining a better understanding of overall concepts of Spanish grammar.
Wonderful professor. Very down to earth and helpful. I highly recommend her.

I really really loved this class. Meghan was really engaging and communicated the material really clearly. She was always willing to answer questions and clarify things. Definitely take class with her if you can.
Loved her! She even talked about prosody which was fascinating!
I had Meghan last autumn for 104. She was so sweet, a GREAT teacher, and very lenient. Genuinely nice person.

i had her during 2nd term over the summer so we had quizzes over the readings every single day. she checked hw sometimes and graded on completion. she was a tough grader on test and the composition compared to other 104 professors that my friends had.overall not a bad teacher, she is probably alot easier during a full term.
Must take!
Great teacher, very helpful, nice to look at.  She keeps the students involved so prepare to be called on.

Great!  Very helpful, very informative.  Cares a lot about her students.  She loves language in general (she does Hispanic Linguistics) so she makes it fun to learn.  However, her Spanish is sometimes hard to understand because she speaks with an Argentine accent.  It just takes a little getting used to.

She's an AWESOME teacher! I had her for 3401 and 3404. I would take her again if she taught any higher level classes. She is super sweet, grades fairly, and seems to always prepare the class for assignments, quizzes, and test. I absolutely LOVE her! TAKE HER!!!

Señorita García was super helpful during office hours and worked with me all semester when I fell behind. I honestly didn't think it would have been too bad if I kept up studying & reviewed more before the tests. I didn't really use the textbook. She's a great teacher who's really willing to help you learn!

Wonderful Spanish teacher. Came into our class when our last teacher finally left after having her child. Class seemed ill prepared for our test and finals; did an awesome filling in and preparing us. Used txt book a lot but only to help us. Fair grading and available for help. A+ for everything.

I had Chirsty for Spanish 104 and Spanish 401 and she has  been my favorite teacher overall at Ohio State. Her grading is very fair and she makes a real effort to make herself available to students. She is very nice and gives good feedback on almost all graded assignments, as opposed to simply marking your answer incorrect.
Very good teacher! Very willing to help! If you have the opportunity to take a class with him you should!
She's a super sweet woman who seems to love what she does.  I would highly recommend her as a professor, as she doesn't get easily distracted and she is very educated in what she teaches.
Really sweet professor. Made Spanish not so boring and was super nice and helpful. Test are really easy if you pay attention or do a little studying. Take this class!
She loves the language and the linguistics of it! She made even an 8am fun. :)
Great teacher!! She was really fun and loves Spanish!

Paij is so sweet.  You can really tell that she cares about her students.  She will often stop and ask the class if something is clear or not before moving on to the next topic.  I would definitely recommend her.

She is a great teacher and I would recommend her to anyone. She really cares about her students and is always willing to help. Her class is very easy, so just be aware that if you aren't applying yourself you may have trouble once you get into Spanish 103. Beyond that she is an amazing professor.

Lucas was one of the best teachers I've ever had at OSU. His teaching style, his demeanor, his eagerness to help and his cultural experience all helped to shape a terrific class. Sadly, he's left the University.

He was awesome, he's really nice and helpful. Easy to understand, tries to make the class enjoyable. He's young so his class is fun. Teaches slang and cuss words. Isn't strict about attendance, very lenient and understanding. Enjoyed his class.

Lucas is American, but his passion for the Spanish language is apparent. He is super casual but gets distressed if you don't use Spanish in class. He taught slang, curse words, and useful phrases each class. I met with him outside of class to talk to him about his experience with Spanish and he was super helpful. I recommend him.
Great professor! He's really easy, and teaches slang/curse words that are really funny and actually suprisingly useful :P Explains things in english if no one understands.

Lucas is an absolute sweetheart. He's extremely helpful, sometimes he speaks quickly but he waits for you to understand. He doesn't always take attendance and he's not very strict. He's very very nice. Take him!

Lucas was amazing. He was always willing to help and was very patient with those who aren't as great at speaking spanish. If people have an issue with the grading you can't blame the Spanish professors...they have a standardized test/scoring system. I would highly recommend him.
Genunily interested in teaching, but not always the best in helping students who are having trouble understanding. Grades kind of hard for only a 104 class
Great guy that really knows Spanish. He's very interested in teaching and helping anyone with a problem. Good sense of humor and grades very fairly. I would completely recommend him!
He knew the language well. Was funny nice and worked with you to make sure you understood things. Great guy.
genuinely interested in teaching and very charming

Lucas shows great interest in wanting his students to undertand and enjoy the language. I loved being in his class, he has great experiences to share about the culture.He offered time outside of class to meet for extra help.If you are serious about learning and undertstanding the material, take his class. He is a kind, fun and helpful!

Lucas was a great teacher! He is very knowledgeable when it comes to spanish language and culture.  He prepared us well for exams and was a very fair grader. Lucas was awesome and a fantastic teacher! I recommend anyone taking spanish to try and schedule with him!

She's a great teacher, but the only thing I didn't like was that I felt like you had to look in four different places for homework assignments. Ended up with a B in the class because I didn't look in the right places for homework. She goes kind of fast during class, but she's a consistent and fair grader.

Tanya was wonderful.  She is very thoroughly involved in the class, and tries very hard to give everyone a good grade.  If you don't do well in her class, it is entirely your fault.  She is very kind and empathetic.  She is a little strict but very reasonable. Some very weak spanish speakers did well in her class. It just takes effort.
Tanya is a great and fun teacher, but some students say she is strict.  No cell phones allowed in class.  I adore this woman, she changed my semester!

She's not a bad teach at all. The people that are commenting that she is negative or a poor teacher were in my class and i could probably tell you which people they were. They were people that did not engage in the class or did not care. Pay attention and try and you'll do fine

The person that said homework was confusing-Yes there was some confusion early on due to the wording on the DEPARTMENT syllabus (the department generates the topics that will be covered); yet she was very easy going, explained it well, was very lenient for honest mistakes. She would allow you to turn it in late (if there was a misunderstanding).
